title: [Question] question of satellite prometheus fetcher
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

I notice that satellite prometheus-fetcher will put some labels(instance, job) to metrics as following. And, satellite will also keep instance label in metadata. 

```
{__name__=apisix_http_status, code=500, instance=localhost:9080, job=prometheus, matched_uri=/2xx, route=t-5xx}
```
In SkyWalking, meter-receiver will also add metadata to labels. Because meter-receiver side builds labels using an immutable hash map, it will throw an exception.

I am confusing whether do we need to put instance and job labels as the metrics labels?
And then do we need to support to rename the label when it is duplication.
author: dmsolr

comments.body: All questions belong to Discussion now.

title: the design of storage log in dataBase
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [√ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
-  (First of all, I'm sorry for I submit the issue again because it's seems I don't make myself clear before ,and now I try to make it more clear)  .     The  method of org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.storage.plugin.jdbc.h2.dao.H2TableInstaller#createTable   occur error  in mysql version 5.5 or lower  (I notice MysqlTableInstaller extends H2TableInstaller) ,and detalis pls look at contents What happened

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS, and JRE?
8.5 version
- Which company or project?
module:   storage-jdbc-hikaricp-plugin
- What happened?
Index colum too large .   I notice  the method of  createTableIndexes in MysqlTableInstaller class, it  make a distinction between Column.getLength() < 256 and extraQueryIndex.  However , the id colum is also index colum default. Such as the inner talbe of skywalking creating: alarm_record ,  the length of  id colum is 512 more than 255, so it occur error : Index colum too large because 512*3  >>767 bytes . And In mysql 5.7 or higher ,it's right because in those version , creating table sql will append ROW_FORMAT=DYNAMIC default but 5.5 or lower is COMPACT. ROW_FORMAT can only act on table but not database , but the creating table  sql is writed by skywalking method in H2TableInstaller#createTable , it seems our user can not change.Our use can only set GLOBAL innodb_large_prefix = ON in mysql ,but it doesn't act on COMPACT (DYNAMIC  is  active)

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
- maybe  append  a row code : tableCreateSQL.appendLine("ROW_FORMAT=DYNAMIC") in H2TableInstaller#createTable  method  , ( COMPACT default and it will change if declare DYNAMIC ) it seems not agreat impact on other code ,and  there are still many users  in mysql5.5 version, could you please consider it ?
author: qiuhuanhen

comments.body: We don't want to make the codes too complex, as basically MySQL single node has a very limited performance to support large scale.
We make length of id to 512 because of it could be that long in the core.

While using the SkyWalking monitoring service, an error was reported while calling a third party interface

`


Trying restemplate, OkHTTP, httpClint is the same case
Attempted to disable SkyWalking monitoring, and the interface resumed fetching
The interface returns to normal when these monitoring plug-ins are removed
An attempt was made to filter the endpoint using Trace, and the interface was normal without error
But treating symptoms does not cure the root cause
What is the reason for this?

When I used the same method to call the local interface, everything worked...
author: YeJiL

comments.body: This is your codes, we can't tell what are you going on. The only thing could say, the plugin isn't compatible with yours.

> 这是你的代码，我们不知道你在做什么。唯一可以说的是，该插件与您的不兼容。
Plugins are not incompatible.
The SkyWalking propagation protocol extends the request header, causing the request to fail.
Is there a good way to deal with it?
Why header affects your codes? If you don't allow that, SkyWalking tracing is not working.

> 为什么标题会影响您的代码？如果您不允许这样做，SkyWalking 跟踪将不起作用。

Because the interface does header verification.
thank you for your help
OK, then it is your responsibility to change. We have 3 header keys.

> OK, then it is your responsibility to change. We have 3 header keys.

When I use the Trace plugin, does it filter only the starting endpoint?

I now have A situation where my microservices are interdialing, and the trace plug-in filters the endpoints that service A needs to filter, but when the link that service B came in is traced to service A, the trace plug-in is invalid
I don't know what is special from your describing. A->B->A is very common. We don't limit it.

> 我不知道你的描述有什么特别之处。A->B->A 很常见。我们不限制它。

Does SkyWalking's Trace plugin filter only starting endpoints? The incoming link of service A is traced to B, but B cannot filter the endpoint

> > 我不知道你的描述有什么特别之处。A->B->A 很常见。我们不限制它。
> 
> Does SkyWalking's Trace plugin filter only starting endpoints? The incoming link of service A is traced to B, but B cannot filter the endpoint

We don't limit this.

> Since many older projects are based on Python2, it is desirable to provide a Python2 agent.

Python2 is end of life for a long time, we have no plan to support that

title: Could skywalking support continued traceContext without invading business code in cross thread situation?
body:

In RocketMQ Consumer , Kafka Consumer or other situations cross thread, is there some methods to continue trace without invading business code? I know some tooklit could support it, but it's not friendly for business group to change code.
author: whl12345

comments.body: We have provided full plugin development doc, which includes the across thread tracing API usage.

### Question

1 - Are there any limits on openapi yaml files? I have used EndpointGroupingRuleReader4OpenapiTest and that class does not load my openapi definition which is over 3000 lines. I figured checkstyle is limiting the definition file limits. Can i increase these values via ENV variable? 

2 - I couldn't tell if skywalking-server correctly loaded my openapi file or not based on logs. I think there should be logging if no file loaded etc.

3 - getGroupRegex method does not care for statically added server context paths. (For example endpoint is /records but server is setup as /api/records). This information usually goes to servers.url in openapi definition (server.url being '/api' in this case). Should we consider such setup?
author: onurccn

comments.body:
> What do you want to know?
1 - Are there any limits on openapi yaml files? I have used EndpointGroupingRuleReader4OpenapiTest and that class does not load my openapi definition which is over 3000 lines. I figured checkstyle is limiting the definition file limits. Can i increase these values via ENV variable?

I think we don't limit size, and checkstyle is only working for IDE, rather than runtime. Could you share more about this?

> 2 - I couldn't tell if skywalking-server correctly loaded my openapi file or not based on logs. I think there should be logging if no file loaded etc.

Welcome to send a pull request to enhance this. This is a new feature, we are glad to see the feedback.

> 3 - getGroupRegex method does not care for statically added server context paths. (For example endpoint is /records but server is setup as /api/records). This information usually goes to servers.url in openapi definition (server.url being '/api' in this case). Should we consider such setup?

We should consider that. Do you have anything to pull request?

Its good to hear that its not applied on runtime. I have placed my openapi file under openapi-definitions folder within project and run tests from IDE, that explains why i couldnt load my file in the first place.

Also I couldn't run tests with openapi-defitinions folder outside project path. (ex. /tmp/openapi-definitions). ClassLoader cant reach that location. Maybe this is happening on runtime as well. Because i think i cant get i to load my yaml files. Glad to provide more detailed feedback if you direct me how to get them.

Did you put the openapi file under `skywalking/oap-server/server-core/src/test/resources/openapi-definitions` ? If you run a test you need to put it under the test resources, not the server-bootstrap resources. There are also some samples under test resources.

title: service_cpm = sum( service_instance_cpm )  ?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
excuse me.
does service_cpm = sum( service_instance_cpm )  ?
in my case, service_cpm !=  sum( service_instance_cpm ) .
author: klmzfyf

comments.body:
Generally, they should match, but if the traffic is too little, it could mismatch.
The real matching thing is traffic_count(not set in OAL, but logically you can). 

CPM = calls / duration.
Such as in hour-level metrics, you at least need 60 calls per hour could have 1 CPM.

> Generally, they should match, but if the traffic is too little, it could mismatch.
> The real matching thing is traffic_count(not set in OAL, but logically you can).
> 
> CPM = calls / duration.
> Such as in hour-level metrics, you at least need 60 calls per hour could have 1 CPM.

thank, Professor Wu

title: Does skywalking support @Trace (java, gradle) annotations on the android side？
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
Does skywalking support @Trace (java, gradle) annotations on the android side, and manual instrumentation to record the trajectory?

I added the relevant parameters of skywalking agent in VM Options and used @Trace annotation. It behaves normally in the springboot program, but it seems to be unsuccessful on the andriod side (java, gradle).

In fact, there is also  no result in a simple program with only the main method.

Looking forward to your reply!
author: SongXueZhi

comments.body: We even don't know whether agent works for Android. No one tested about this. Or for further, I think Android doesn't support agent mode at all, doesn't it?

Okay, thanks for your answer. I may need to conduct more survey on Android. There may be some instrumentation techniques that can be considered.

Anyway, SkyWakling is the best practice of OpenTelemetry, and we are trying to apply SkyWalking to collect traces in a complex system environment, and then further carry out some warning and debugging work on the traces.

For example, the robot system, which contains extremely heterogeneous environment, include various languages (java, c++, python, etc.), protocols (coap, mqtt, etc.), systems (Android, linux, etc.), Even diversified hardware .

Could you please share some suggestions, that will greatly promote our work!

Java, c++ and python all have agents. Linux is more about monitoring not tracing.
Protocols don't matter, it relies on the language agent plugins in tracing case.

title: When configuring a gateway without the agent installed in gateways.yml, can the topology be improved?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [x] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Requirement or improvement

If the gateway does not have a agent installed, after configuring it in `gateways.yml`, the upstream and downstream of the gateway cannot be displayed in the topology. The topology display is incomplete.

For example: 

Service A calls service B through the gateway. Select service A in the topology, it shows this:

```
A --> Gateway
```

Select service B in the topology, it shows this:

```
Gateway --> B
```

But I think the desired topology should be like this:

```
A --> B
```

Here is another complicated example:
Service A calls service B through the gateway. Service C calls service D through the gateway. 
If services A, B, and D are in a group, and this group is selected in the topology, it shows this:

```
                        
A --> Gateway --> B
         |
         ↓
         D
```

It is easy to be misunderstood that service A calls service D through the gateway.
author: heihaozi

comments.body:
> But I think the desired topology should be like this:

I don't think this is expected. Could you explain your point?

> Service A calls service B through the gateway. Service C calls service D through the gateway.
If services A, B, and D are in a group, and this group is selected in the topology, it shows this:

This is always what we expect to see, `one-level-jump` group topology never would be complete topology. 

___
Besides all above, why you don't have an agent on Gateway? This uninstrumented setting is for a gateway not supported, but SkyWalking covers most popular gateway, even the ones we don't, I think you should add for them.

Thank you for such a quick response.

For example, when `service A` is called, it is called through `gateway G`.

In the topology, only the calls of `service A` and `gateway G` are shown.

However, which real services call `service A` through `gateway G` is very necessary from a business perspective.

Yes, I know. Your description is correct. My point is, topology is not about data flowing. From topology, you always could find this edge case, no matter how many jumps you are going to show.
You could try yo think in this way.
I got it, thank you for your answers.

title: Why skywalking need add a new  ‘_$EnhancedClassField_ws’ filed and Is there any potential such risk?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion

___
### Question
- Why skywalking need add a new  ‘_$EnhancedClassField_ws’ filed into origin source class when skywalking do enhance logic.
Is there any potential such risk about this logic? For example as below:
      When the business code takes out all the fields of a class (which has been enhanced by bytecode) through reflection for processing, it will also take out '_$EnhancedClassField_ws'  field for logical processing, which will cause problems.
author: gaoweijie

comments.body: Your question is very hard to answer. In any case, with any form, you could say adding codes always have a bug. So, from a tech perspective, the answer would only have to be YES. There is a risk.
If you look at the source codes of plugin, such as popular SpringMVC, you will see why we need that.

> If you look at the source codes of plugin, such as popular SpringMVC, you will see why we need that.

OK, thanks.

I carefully read the source code of springmvc, still have a little incomprehensible about '$EnhancedClassField_ws' field's reson and purpose.
Can you give me some explanation or inspiration.
Thank you very much.
You need a class level cache to hold the context for instrumentation. Otherwise, you have to resolve the context every time, which is a big performance issue.

> You need a class level cache to hold the context for instrumentation. Otherwise, you have to resolve the context every time, which is a big performance issue.

Thanks.

title: agent sampling config option `sample_n_per_3_secs `
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
SAMPLE_N_PER_3_SECS is -1 by default which means sampling N TraceSegment in 3 seconds tops in the document.

I have two questions:
- What's the max value? `N` means unlimited？
- What is the reasonable range?  Many documents suggest it is in 500~1500, and is it right?
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS, and JRE?
v8.3.0
- Which company or project?
Inspur
- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: luckymrwang

comments.body:
> What's the max value? N means unlimited？
What is the reasonable range? Many documents suggest it is in 500~1500, and is it right?

No recommendation. SkyWalking Java agent could work in 100% sampling in 5000 tps only with 10% extra CPU. We designed this years ago to support large scale distributed system.

```
log.info( "===Headers-traceId==={}", traceId );
```

title: A question about MetricsPersistentWorker context map
author: andyzzl

comments.body:
>  a metrics object which not stored in context is considered as a new metrics, otherwise, it needs to be combined with the old metrics in context

This is not a correct conclusion. Read `#loadFromStorage`, `context#put` is called if metrics could be loaded from database.
Sorry I didn't make it clear. I mean after `loadFromStorage` called, if a metrics can't be found in `context` still,  it is a new metrics.

> Sorry I didn't make it clear. I mean after `loadFromStorage` called, if a metrics can't be found in `context` still, it is a new metrics.

Why it isn't?  It means you need to insert it into the database, rather than updating.
After prepareRequests generated, we can put it into context, both db and context are updated. So we don’t need to query db in next run.

That depends on the context. I deleted a comment about this.

Thinking about this, if your service includes parameterized URI, such as `/prod/{id}/create`, but you don't always have grouping rules, or SpringMVC(even you have, there is Gateway before your Spring controller codes), then every request could create different endpoints. All these endpoints have one access but cost memory for nearly 1 minute.(context only has an expired period).
Considering this, do you still want to add this logic?
Oh, I never thought of this situation. It do cost too much memory. Thank you for your explanation.

title: How to implement a metric which is computed by previous collected data?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ √] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- How to implement a metric which is computed by previous collected data?
- For example, at time T, the JVM thread count is 10, and at time T-1, the JVM thread count is 5, 
 what I want to compute is the increment of the JVM thread count, which is 5 computed by 10 subtracts 5.
 We want to use the metric of the increment of the JVM thread count to do alarm behaviors.
author: JelfPann

comments.body: MAL has a rate function for it.

I have learned about 
```
browser_app_error_rate = from(BrowserAppTraffic.*).rate(trafficCategory == BrowserAppTrafficCategory.FIRST_ERROR, trafficCategory == BrowserAppTrafficCategory.NORMAL); 
``` 
but my case is different.
In my case, only `ServiceInstanceJVMThread.liveCount` is used as the condition. I do not know how to compare with the past value.
Could you show me a example?
I think this is not available through OAL. All metrics should transfer into MeterSystem, and use MAL to run analysis. There is a `rate` function there.

I do have learned ablout MAL as possible as I can. But I could just get a few of docs about it.
Firstly, I am very confused of the Meter and Metric.
In my debug practice, when JVM info of the agent received, only OAL works to process it. I can't find where the stream data go to the meter system.
The config file `meter-analyzer-config/spring-sleuth.yaml` seems not working. 
I do not know how the following scrpit works or whether it worked.
```
expSuffix: instance(['service'], ['instance'])
metricPrefix: meter
metricsRules:
  - name: jvm_threads_live
    exp: jvm_threads_live
```
JVM metrics right now are only for OAL I am afraid. Unless you or someone contribute this and change it to MAL core, I don't think your requirement is possible.

title: Does the Meter data structure support users to dynamically create multiple thread pools to automatically collectt metric datas
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
Does the Meter data structure support users to dynamically create multiple thread pools to automatically collectt metric datas?

The meter table structure only has entity_id, service_id, and no extended field to save the thread pool name dynamically to save user created thread pool.

 MAL also supports only fixed index names to YAML files and cannot dynamically generate index names based on multiple thread pools created by the user.
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS, and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.

comments.body:
There is an open PR about thread monitoring, but he didn't finish it.
Multiple pools should be treated as labeled values, with using label key as pool name.
Make sense?
No monitoring system build dynamic indices, even we had, you can't set the UI.

title: Add alarm conditions
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [x] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.

Is it possible to add such a condition to the alert rule to trigger an alarm after the service or endpoint receives more than the least requests. Because in the low period of business, there may be a few of abnormal requests, resulting in an alarm.

```
rules:
  service_resp_time_rule:
    metrics-name: service_resp_time
    threshold: 1000
    op: ">"
    period: 10
    count: 1
```
There may be only one request, but an alarm is triggered because the response time of this request exceeds the threshold. We hope that at least 100 requests will trigger the alarm, so as to avoid unexpected alarms.

such as:
```
rules:
  service_resp_time_rule:
    metrics-name: service_resp_time
    threshold: 1000
    op: ">"
    period: 10
    count: 1
    least: 100
```
author: amwyyyy

comments.body: The composite rule is for this. Set the rules including CPM/count and latency.

What is the difference between the service's cpm and the service instance's spm? title: Add alarm rule management page.
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [x] Feature or performance improvement
___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
I feel that the current alarm rules  are very complex and difficult to manage. Maybe we can add an alarm rule management page in the alarm page to visualize it. When we modify the alarm rules
  1. When the dynamic data source is configured, the added rule will be synchronized to the dynamic data source
  2. When the dynamic data source is not configured, the added rules will only exist in the memory
 
In the future, we may be able to visualize other configurations as well, so that users can use skywalking more conveniently.

comments.body: We don't get us involved in the management UI. You could setup a new project for it, as it has to adopt different configuration center servers, even k8s.

title: Installing skywalking via helm and using external elasticsearch how to specify storage.elasticsearch.namespace for skywalking
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion

___
### Question
-  Installing skywalking via helm and using external elasticsearch how to specify `storage.elasticsearch.namespace` for skywalking?  （通过helm安装skywalking，并且使用外部的elasticsearch服务，如何为skywalking指定）`storage.elasticsearch.namespace`
- How to filter endpoints for business-specific exceptions or error tracing? （如何为端点过滤特定的业务异常或错误的追踪）

- These questions above can be summarized as, what is the best practice of using skywalking in K8S platform and can you provide a sample for us to learn from.（上面这些问题可以汇总为，在K8S平台使用skywalking的最佳实践是什么样的，能否提供一个样本供我们借鉴。）
author: eltonbfw

comments.body:
1. You could use the system env to override all configurations. Document has included this.
2. I don't think we provide this kind of feature.
3. Best practice is from end users, rather than the dev team. This is not a proper question.

title: Startup performance after the agent is integrated
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ * ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
If the service is not integrated with the agent, it takes 30 seconds to start the service. After the integration, it takes 50 seconds to start the service.In the same case, when the pinpoint agent is used, the startup time is increased by only 3s.
Why does the startup time increase so much after the Skywalking agent is integrated? Is there any optimization in the future?thx.
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS, and JRE?
8.4.0，k8s，1.8

If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

title: why createIndex in HistoryDeleteEsDAO#deleteHistory?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- Question or discussion

___
### Question
- why createIndex in HistoryDeleteEsDAO#deleteHistory?
When chosing elasticsearch as oap-server's storage, DataTTLKeeperTimer executes HistoryDeleteEsDAO#deleteHistory every 5(default) minutes to delete expired timeseries index, this may cause heavy perfomance loss. Thus I try to set enableDataKeeperExecutor=false to disable DataTTLKeeperTimer and set index ttl on es cluster, but new index will not be created. This is because new index is only created in HistoryDeleteEsDAO#deleteHistory and in oap-server bootstrap.
I wonder why not seperate deleteHistory and createIndex into two timers, DataTTLKeeperTimer takes responsibility for delete expired index, and a new Timer takes in charge of creating new index in elasticsearch.
author: system-designer

comments.body: If you have the data on a new day, a new index will be created. I am not sure how you tested this, but the index creation is not only TTL timer's responsibility

comments.body:
(1) After you read the source codes, you will notice, there is a combination/merge operation between memory and database. If read the dirty data in the next round, the update would not be accurate. Performance is a thing having a lower priority than accuracy. Otherwise, there is pointless.
(2) I don't agree with you. `refresh_interval` only relates to the record-type data, mostly traces, and logs. (1) is about metrics.

title: A requirement of "slow statements"
body:
### Requirement or improvement
1、Whether we can add a display of SQL execution times in "slow statements" or sort according to the execution times, in practical work, we pay more attention to those slow queries that are executed the most times. Some slow queries may be executed once a day or at a longer interval, and the relative priority may not be the highest.
2、Whether "slow statements" can be associated with specific services (for example, add a "current service" to the right of "current database" as an optional condition), so that when troubleshooting problems, we can quickly locate which service slow SQL comes from.
author: OPSTime

comments.body:
1. This is not easy to do. Because the slow statement is based on a sampling mechanism. It is hard to get the execution time.
2. You have to change codes to do that. You could set up the top N metrics to get the SQL list on the service level dashboard. The reason we don't do this, because accessing the same database from different services is not recommended in the distributed architecture. I am not sure why you are doing this.
Please keep the discussion in English. We need things open for the global.

1. The frequency of slow SQL call can be reflected by the frequency of slow SQL in sampling data, which is also of great reference value

2. After being associated with specific services, it is convenient to quickly locate problems. Do we have to recall in our brain or look up the code to find out which service is related to? There are also multiple tables in a database. Different tables correspond to different services in use, or in different databases of the same instance. It is impossible to completely realize that one service corresponds to one database instance. Cost should be considered in the production environment.

title: A little confused about the alarm rules
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [X] Question or discussion
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
I am a little confused about the conception of the alarm rule, even after I read the document  many times.

- How often will the data be evaluated? If I set the _Period_ to be 10, will it evaluate the data of the past 10 minutes every 1 minute? Or I can set the interval in somewhere?
- What _Count_ exactly means? If I set the _Count_ to be 2, and the _Period_ to be 10,  does it means the metric reach the alarm condition for 20 minutes? Or twice of the evaluated interval?
author: ppliuppliu

comments.body: Think in this way, period is windows of metric slot. Count means how many slots over the threshold in the given window.

How to understand _how many slots_? Take response time as an example. When the application throughput is relatively high, there are hundreds of requests per second, and each request has a response time. Does each request count as a count?
In the storage, all metrics have been downsampling into minutes. Such as CPM in 21:54 is one slot, the next is 21:55. What is your traffic load, doesn't matter.

title: Agent performance overhead
body:

- Why do you submit this issue?

### Question
- What do you want to know?
Is there any optimization method for the performance overhead caused by the access agent?For example, we have a service that is not connected to Skywalking. The JVM runs for 31 seconds and the service starts for 24 seconds. After Skywalking is interconnected, the JVM runs for 99 seconds, but the service starts for only 52 seconds.
In addition, can I set a sampling policy on the agent side? For example, successful partial sampling and failed full sampling.

8.3.0

comments.body:
We don't have bootstrap performance. Runtime overhead, we have.
Read the document.
In addition, can I set a sampling policy on the agent side? For example, successful partial sampling and failed full sampling.
Read the documentation and follow the guide there.
But the document doesn't say that...
Which document says something not provided? If it doesn't exist on the document, but it is not a feature.

title: about server side load balance questions
body:
- [x] Question or discussion

___
### Question
agent could set the collector server list , but application access increases, the server needs to expand. 

And we don't want to edit agent config(too many applications),

- so we consider  server side LB like F5 or LVS,is that a good idea?

- Another questions is  that backend supports  cluster management , agent why not get collector server list from consul 、zk or somethings else  ?
author: DeadLion

comments.body:
1. We recommend Envoy proxy, Nginx, or similar HTTP2 supported L7 proxy.
2. We answered this many times. Please search issue before submit. Short version, typically, agents and OAP servers are in different VPCs. The things you mentioned wouldn't work.

thanks for anwser

we use consul for our micro services ,It's natural to use for skywalking server cluster management.
now skywalking agent trace these micro services ,so they are in same VPC.  maybe  our network is too simple.

maybe we could put those questions often be asked on FAQs @wu-sheng

> we use consul for our micro services ,It's natural to use for skywalking server cluster management.
now skywalking agent trace these micro services ,so they are in same VPC. maybe our network is too simple.

Your case may be not typically for larger scale deployment. In many cases, one company(big enterprise) has over 200 services, which are deployed even in different VPCs, K8s, data center. It is pointless to set a service discovery to resolve this, especially in today's cloud native tech stack, proxy is widely used, and good at it.

With apm-toolkit-trace, trace id can be generated normally even without oap.

title: log have no data ,how to config the log collect server
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion


___
### Question
logback_spring.xml 
`<conversionRule conversionWord="tid" converterClass="org.apache.skywalking.apm.toolkit.log.logback.v1.x.LogbackPatternConverter"/>

    <appender name="STDOUT" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">

        <encoder charset="UTF-8" class="net.logstash.logback.encoder.LogstashEncoder">
            <provider class="org.apache.skywalking.apm.toolkit.log.logback.v1.x.logstash.TraceIdJsonProvider">
            </provider>
        </encoder>
        <encoder class="net.logstash.logback.encoder.LoggingEventCompositeJsonEncoder">
            <providers>
                <pattern>
                    <pattern>
                        {
                        "timestamp":"%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss}",
                        "level": "%level",
                        "tid": "%tid",
                        "thread": "%thread",
                        "class": "%logger{1.}:%L",
                        "message": "%message",
                        "stackTrace": "%exception{10}"
                        }
                    </pattern>
                </pattern>
            </providers>
        </encoder>
    </appender>
    <appender name="grpc-log" class="org.apache.skywalking.apm.toolkit.log.logback.v1.x.log.GRPCLogClientAppender"/>
    <root level="INFO">
        <appender-ref ref="STDOUT"/>
    </root>`

print log

`{"timestamp":"2021-02-20 14:10:09","level":"INFO","tid":"TID:Ignored_Trace","thread":"qtp658673405-54","class":"com.test.common.logging.LogFilter:100","message":"Request uri:/favicon.ico, params: ","stackTrace":""}
{"timestamp":"2021-02-20 14:10:09","level":"INFO","tid":"TID:Ignored_Trace","thread":"qtp658673405-54","class":"com.test.common.logging.LogFilter:72","message":"Request uri:/favicon.ico, cost:6ms","stackTrace":""}`


why skyworking ui  log module show  no data? 
trace is working
author: wangruice

comments.body:
> ```xml
> <root level="INFO">
>    <appender-ref ref="STDOUT"/>
> </root>
> ```

This is a simple cause, you configure an appender but didn't use it, try 

```xml
<root level="INFO">
    <appender-ref ref="STDOUT"/>
    <appender-ref ref="grpc-log"/>
</root>
```

### Question
Have setup the composite rule but alarms are not coming although Time-Bucket is overlapping , Please help if anything wrong in configuration. I am using Skywaling8.3

Configuration  - 
alarm-settings.yml

```yaml
rules:
  service_instance_resp_time_alert_rule:
    metrics-name: service_instance_resp_time
    op: ">"
    threshold: 100
    period: 5
    count: 1
    message: Response time of is more than 100ms in 1 count of last 5 minutes Message1
  service_instance_jvm_cpu__alert_rule:
    metrics-name: instance_jvm_cpu
    op: ">"
    threshold: 20
    period: 5
    count: 1
    message: service_instance_jvm_cpu is more than 20% in 1  times in last 5 minutes  Message2
composite-rules:

    expression: service_instance_resp_time_alert_rule && service_instance_jvm_cpu__alert_rule
    message: Message4
    expression: (service_instance_resp_time_alert_rule || service_instance_jvm_cpu__alert_rule)
    message: Message5
    expression: service_instance_resp_time_alert_rule
```

comments.body: @xbkaishui Anything you can see from the data?

> ```yaml
> composite-rules:
>   comp_rule:
>     expression: service_instance_resp_time_alert_rule && service_instance_jvm_cpu__alert_rule
>     message: Message4

>     message: Message6

This is not a valid yaml file (b/c you have duplicate keys `expression` and `message` under section `comp_rule`), try this 

```yaml
# ... the other configurations
composite-rules:
  comp1_rule:
    expression: service_instance_resp_time_alert_rule && service_instance_jvm_cpu__alert_rule
    message: Message4
  comp2_rule:
    expression: (service_instance_resp_time_alert_rule || service_instance_jvm_cpu__alert_rule)
    message: Message5
  comp3_rule:
    expression: service_instance_resp_time_alert_rule
    message: Message7
  comp4_rule:
    expression: service_instance_jvm_cpu__alert_rule
    message: Message8
  comp5_rule:
    expression: service_instance_jvm_cpu__alert_rule && service_instance_jvm_memory_heap_alert_rule
    message: Message6
```

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS, and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: xiangwangcheng

comments.body: What do you mean? If you want to change anything, all source codes are open for you.

@xiangwangcheng for `role` and `RoleBinding`, if you don't enable Envoy ALS (or you don't know what Envoy ALS is), you can safely delete it, at this time, it takes no effect at all so leaving them there does no harm.

But SkyWalking OAP needs a service account, hence you cannot delete `oap-serviceaccount.yaml`

> @xiangwangcheng for `role` and `RoleBinding`, if you don't enable Envoy ALS (or you don't know what Envoy ALS is), you can safely delete it, at this time, it takes no effect at all so leaving them there does no harm.
> 
> But SkyWalking OAP needs a service account, hence you cannot delete `oap-serviceaccount.yaml`

Thank you for the quick reply!

title: oap or storage performance
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
When we used pinpoint before, we encountered some performance problems on pinpoint data storage. Therefore, we plan to find better alternatives and want to compare it. Do you have more detailed design documents and performance tests for data storage on skywalking? 
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS, and JRE?
 JDK1.8.0_65,ES7.6.2, sky8.3.0
- Which company or project?

- What happened?

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.
By configuring some parameters such as agent.sample_n_per_3_secs, we can see that some ingored_trace will be ignored in the log. If the configuration does not have these, are all uploaded to OAP? OAP For the upload of thousands of nodes, we can configure some parameters such as agent .sample_n_per_3_secs, I can see that some ingored_trace will be ignored in the log, so if the configuration does not have these, are all uploaded to OAP? Does OAP have problems with the upload performance of our thousands of nodes?
author: HarryFQG

comments.body: We don't have that for public. But you could easily find 100+ TB and 10+ PB level use cases without performance issue.
SkyWalking doesn't rely on calculate performance of db like pinpoint did. So there is nothing to compare. Basically, we are different, and read the STAM paper to understand what we do.

title: Does toolkit can support wrapper an executor?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [x] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.

I am writing a second-party lib that provide a manager of the thread executors. I want wrapper the executors so that the user can easily execute a task or submit a callable without wrap it manually.
author: wallezhang

comments.body: I can see `org.apache.skywalking.apm.toolkit.trace.CallableWrapper` exists already, what else are you asking?

I don't want user wrap `Callable` or `Runnable` manually when invoke `submit()` function. 
e.g. I have an executor 
```
private final ExecutorService executor = ExecutorServiceWrapper
            .of(new ThreadPoolExecutor(5, 10, 1L, TimeUnit.MINUTES,
                    new ArrayBlockingQueue<>(100),
                    new ThreadFactoryBuilder().setNameFormat("refresh-all-value-thread-%d").setDaemon(true).build());
```

And user can invoke `execute()` or `submit()` without wrap the runnable.
What is the difference? If you control the `ExecutorServiceWrapper`, you could wrap the `Runnable` to SkyWalking's wrapper internally.
In fact, there is no difference. However, this can reduce the amount of code when user invoke `execute()` and also reduce the probability of forgetting wrap the task. 😄
I mean you could. Rather than user's work. `ExecutorServiceWrapper` could wrap the input parameter.
Yes, I have done.

author: JHub-Wei

comments.body:
I think the error is very clear
```
Caused by: javax.security.auth.login.LoginException: unable to find LoginModule class: org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext.invoke(LoginContext.java:794)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext.access$000(LoginContext.java:195)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext$4.run(LoginContext.java:682)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext$4.run(LoginContext.java:680)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext.invokePriv(LoginContext.java:680)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext.login(LoginContext.java:587)
```

Class isn't found. Do Kafka or your JDK require to add some jars in the class loader? We should release codes with `javax.*`.

This is my configuration in agent.config:
plugin.kafka.producer_config[sasl.jaas.config]=org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule required \
username="xxx" \
password="***";
plugin.kafka.producer_config[sasl.mechanism]=PLAIN
plugin.kafka.producer_config[security.protocol]=SASL_SSL
plugin.kafka.producer_config[ssl.truststore.location]=/xxx/skywalking/agent/config/client.truststore.jks
plugin.kafka.producer_config[ssl.truststore.password]=***
plugin.kafka.producer_config[ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm]=
but the class PlainLoginModule is found in kafka-clients-2.4.1.jar
I think this is out of SkyWalking's scope. This is a Kafka side solution. Read their documents, to see how to use this in Kafka directly.

My solution is that the `org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule` class needs to be configured as `org.apache.skywalking.apm.dependencies.org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule`. The complete configuration is as follows: 
```
plugin.kafka.producer_config[security.protocol]=SASL_PLAINTEXT
plugin.kafka.producer_config[sasl.mechanism]=PLAIN
plugin.kafka.producer_config[sasl.jaas.config]=org.apache.skywalking.apm.dependencies.org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule required username="" password="";
plugin.kafka.producer_config[enable.idempotence]=false
```

title: [javaagent] agent.sample_n_per_3_secs config stands for TraceSegment?
body:
Dear skywalking team.
As I read skywalking agent code, **agent.sample_n_per_3_secs** this config stands for upper limit of TraceSegment, is it right?
As one TraceSegment can hold many spans, just suppose 1 TraceSegment has 3 spans, 
if **agent.sample_n_per_3_secs** set to 150, then the upper limit of spans has been 450.
Is it right?
author: lijial

comments.body: Yes, but span doesn't matter for SkyWalking, especially at the storage level.

@wu-sheng 
>Yes, but span doesn't matter for SkyWalking, especially at the storage level.


**agent.sample_n_per_3_secs** config cannot measure network flow accuracy
Even **agent.sample_n_per_3_secs** is numeric small , but the whole network flow could be numeric big. 
The more spans, the high network flow.
So I would think agent.config need a new config **agent.spans_n_per_3_secs**

Network flow means from javaagent trace data to collector, As high network flow would influence app.jar
Read the document, there is a config called `SPAN_LIMIT_PER_SEGMENT` to do this. But less spans could break your traces, do the client side tracing is not working because of this.

> Read the document, there is a config called `SPAN_LIMIT_PER_SEGMENT` to do this. But less spans could break your traces, do the client side tracing is not working because of this.

OK,I see, thank you

title: Why only grpc to send trace data, not http?
body:
Hi SkyWalking team

As I choose SkyWalking to trace, Some question confuse me
___
### Question

In   v5.0.0-beta2  , there is  embed jetty, javaagent could send tracedata to collector use http
In   v6.0.0-GA and later versions, there is only grpc . 
Why remove jetty/http? 
Is the reason only grpc performance better? 
Now can I use http to send tracedata? is there any worse situation from http?
author: lijial

comments.body:
> Why remove jetty/http?

You are not following the latest, it is back, but we only recommend for the languages don't support grpc.

> Is the reason only grpc performance better?

Yes, much much better than JSON based HTTP.

> Now can I use http to send tracedata? is there any worse situation from HTTP?

Send, I don't know, that depends on the agent or SDK. As OAP server, we support that.

@wu-sheng 
>Now can I use http to send tracedata? is there any worse situation from HTTP?
Deal wu-sheng, Thanks for your reply , as this question I should not understand your answer, 
As I use 8.4.0  ,  I can use http?  And you support to use http? 
Are there still several kind of agent ? 
As I only know only one agent and OAP server...

@lijial if you mean to send the data in Java agent with HTTP, it's not supported, for Java agent, we only support gRPC.

The OAP backend can receive HTTP data because some languages are hard to use gRPC, Nginx Lua for example

@wu-sheng 
> @lijial if you mean to send the data in Java agent with HTTP, it's not supported, for Java agent, we only support gRPC.
> 
> The OAP backend can receive HTTP data because some languages are hard to use gRPC, Nginx Lua for example

OK，this is what I wanna know. And 8.4.0 version not support javaagent using HTTP either?
I think that would be never due to no reason to do this.

> I think that would be never due to no reason to do this.

As our company use skywalking but grpc not stable in some situation. So I wanna change the grpc to http.
If it's just performance, and our flow is  low as 10k/s. 
Should I change the agent to use http? 
Is it necessary for safety and stability for me to do so？
I don't know what do you mean grpc is not stable. But from my understanding, it is really widely adopted. You could change the codes by yourself, for stability, that depends on your codes only.

> I don't know what do you mean grpc is not stable. But from my understanding, it is really widely adopted. You could change the codes by yourself, for stability, that depends on your codes only.

OK，I know, thankyou
And is there SPI interface  in javaagent, Easy for me to extend data transmission using http?
See how Kafak reporter works. It is the same way for other reporters.

title: How to review the gRPC request/response data in trace view?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

Can we review the request & response data in trace view of Skywalking Rocketbot?
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

SkyWalking 8.2

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.

We have several services using gRPC to communicate with each other, and try using SkyWalking to deal with the trace stuff.
We can find out the complete call chain and each span info in trace view of Rocketbot, that's really nice. But sometimes we hope to review the request or response data of the gRPC call in one span, can we do that with SkyWalking?

title: How to enable Alarm funtion in debug mode？
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
1. Besides _alarm-settings.xml_ to uncomment the webhooks setting, what else should we do to enable Alarm function？
Since, I start a Spring MVC app in debug mode, a local OAP, and the settings meet, but it doesn't go to my breakpoint. Could you help?
2. From source code, it looks like the webhook response is formatted in _AlarmMessageFormatter_?

title: how could I get `service_relation_server_cpm metric` by `HOUR` or `DAY`
body:
I am using ```GraphQL``` to query the ```service_relation_server_cpm``` metric from OAP, It's ok when  the ```Duration``` is step by ```MINUTE```. while set the step by ```HOUR``` or ```DAY```, the 	```value``` is always ```0```.

OAP version ```7.0.0```

## query

```
	
query: quryTopoInfo($duration: Duration!) {
	cpmS: getLinearIntValues(metric:{
		name: "service_relation_server_cpm"
		id: "9_10"
	}, duration: $duration) {
      values {
        id
        value
      }
    }
}
	
```

## step by minute 

##### Variables

```
{"duration":{"start":"2020-12-02 0930","end":"2020-12-02 0935","step":"MINUTE"}}

```

##### Response

```
{"data":{"cpmS":{"values":[{"id":"202012020930_9_10","value":5},{"id":"202012020931_9_10","value":3},{"id":"202012020932_9_10","value":3},{"id":"202012020933_9_10","value":7},{"id":"202012020934_9_10","value":2},{"id":"202012020935_9_10","value":8}]}}}
```


## step by hour

##### Variables

```
{"duration":{"start":"2020-12-02 09","end":"2020-12-02 10","step":"HOUR"}}

```

##### Response

```
{"data":{"cpmS":{"values":[{"id":"2020120209_9_10","value":0},{"id":"2020120210_9_10","value":0}]}}}

```

## step by day

##### Variables

```
{"duration":{"start":"2020-12-01","end":"2020-12-02","step":"DAY"}}

```

##### Response

```
{"data":{"cpmS":{"values":[{"id":"20201201_9_10","value":0},{"id":"20201202_9_10","value":0}]}}}

```


## the data store in the es

```
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"202012020935_9_10","_score":5.6863337,"_source":{"total":8,"time_bucket":202012020935,"entity_id":"9_10","value":8}},
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"202012020936_9_10","_score":5.6863337,"_source":{"total":3,"time_bucket":202012020936,"entity_id":"9_10","value":3}},
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"20201202_9_10","_score":5.6863337,"_source":{"total":30,"time_bucket":20201202,"entity_id":"9_10","value":0}},
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"202012020931_9_10","_score":5.6863337,"_source":{"total":3,"time_bucket":202012020931,"entity_id":"9_10","value":3}},
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"202012020932_9_10","_score":5.6863337,"_source":{"total":3,"time_bucket":202012020932,"entity_id":"9_10","value":3}},
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"202012020933_9_10","_score":5.6863337,"_source":{"total":7,"time_bucket":202012020933,"entity_id":"9_10","value":7}},
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"202012020934_9_10","_score":5.6863337,"_source":{"total":2,"time_bucket":202012020934,"entity_id":"9_10","value":2}},
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"202012020930_9_10","_score":3.5491176,"_source":{"total":5,"time_bucket":202012020930,"entity_id":"9_10","value":5}},
{"_index":"service_relation_server_cpm-20201202","_type":"_doc","_id":"2020120209_9_10","_score":3.5491176,"_source":{"total":30,"time_bucket":2020120209,"entity_id":"9_10","value":0}},

```

there are two problems i am confused

1. the ```value``` field of item ```_id: 20201202_9_10``` and ```_id: 2020120209_9_10``` is ```0```.

1. the ```total``` field of item ```_id: 20201202_9_10``` and ```_id: 2020120209_9_10``` is ```30``` , which is not equals ```8 + 3 + 3 + 3 + 7+ 2 + 5 = 31 ```

title: Metrics data  persistence question
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bux
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___

### Question

- What do you want to know?

  We use skywalking version 8.2.0, and use ES cluster to store data, five data nodes (cpu: 16 memery: 32G). But his QPS is only 2W at most, and ES throws EsRejectedExcutionException, so kafka has a lot of news accumulation. The highest accumulation reaches 200 million. After we made various optimizations to ES, we found that the effect was very small.
  We will look at the code later and find that the segment data is written asynchronously and the metrics is written synchronously.

   metrics persistence code in `org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.core.storage.PersistenceTimer.

   It needs to use the previous storage for calculations, and it needs to query the previous data and can only be written synchronously.There are two problems:

  1. Synchronous writing is very slow, and some data needs to be updated, which will block ES from processing other requests.
  2. Synchronous writing does not limit the size of the requested data.

  Later, we observed a phenomenon, a synchronous request has 2w data, which takes 10000ms, so ES will block the processing of this request, and if the time is too long, it will discard other asynchronous requests and throw EsRejectedExcutionException.

- How we solved it

  We removed the writing of metrics data, so we also lost the metrics data in skywalking。

  Because this kind of persistence will greatly affect the write performance, you can do calculations when querying and not doing calculations when writing. In this way, when we write data, we can write asynchronously, so QPS will be improved a lot, but this will change a lot. . .

  The above are the problems I encountered in using skywalking and some suggestions of my own. : )
author: haoyann

comments.body:
I don't know the performance of your Elasticsearch, but there are many cases supporting TB even PB level analysis nd persistent. There is no performance issue.

We limited the size per batch of metrics persistent. I don't know what is your meaning.

You remove the metrics persistent, which is your choice, not the optimization.

comments.body: Sorry, `fail to bind` is not a thing we could fix. Please check the Jetty/gRPC document and FAQ, maybe some clues there.

> Sorry, `fail to bind` is not a thing we could fix. Please check the Jetty/gRPC document and FAQ, maybe some clues there.

I am not familiar with java. If I don't use skywalking oap docker，try the same config by using skywaking binary package，jetty and grpc server can bind eth0 ip successly, this error only happened in docker. Could you give me some clue? Thanks!

> If I don't use skywalking oap docker，try the same config by using skywaking binary package，jetty and grpc server can bind eth0 ip successly, this error only happened in docker. Could you give me some clue? Thanks!

@bigwalnut I don't think you can simply configure `SW_CORE_GRPC_HOST` or `SW_CORE_REST_HOST` to `100.65.136.30` because this IP is in your host machine, what you should do is to just bind `0.0.0.0` in the docker container, and map the port of that container to your host ip `100.65.136.30` and port `11800`, take a quick try on something like `docker run -p 100.65.136.30:11800:11800 -p 100.65.136.30:12800:12800 <the-docker-image-name>`

```
    metricsDataTTL: ${SW_CORE_METRICS_DATA_TTL:7} # Unit is day
```

title: how to modify traceId
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [*] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

1. how can i trace my project myself

the client is just

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.skywalking</groupId>
      <artifactId>apm-toolkit-trace</artifactId>
      <version>${skywalking.version}</version>
      <scope>provided</scope>
    </dependency>

or more

2. can i modify traceId, so it can associate another
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: wuxingye

comments.body: You cannot do that via the toolkit. We don't support that now. If the trace breaks, you should find out why, simply modifying the trace id may make things worse.
As for how to trace by yourself, please read the doc, it's clearly documented.

As i publish a topic to redis, when i subscribe it, the traceId lose

I wanna add the traceId to data, and modify subscribe traceId, so the to trace linked

> As i publish a topic to redis, when i subscribe it, the traceId lose
> 
> I wanna add the traceId to data, and modify subscribe traceId, so the to trace linked

I personally don't suggest to do that (and the toolkit doesn't have such APIs, as I said above), in my opinion, you should consider enhancing the Redis plugin(or create one) to propagate the tracing context in the PubSub mode, maybe the Redis plugin currently doesn't support that mode

title: Will there be a page to configure alarm rules and hot deploy them?
body: Alarm webhooks sometimes very useful, we can get the running status of our systems in time, will there be a page to configure alarm rules and hot deploy them or take effect in a minute?Thank you!
author: nimeijian

comments.body:
We have dynamic configurations for them already. But whether will be a page is a question we can't answer. If there are contributors to do this, then yes. 
This is how the community works. We don't decide, we collaborate with people.

> Alarm webhooks sometimes very useful, we can get the running status of our systems in time, will there be a page to configure alarm rules and hot deploy them or take effect in a minute?Thank you!

If you're using dynamic configuration, most of the implementations(Apollo, Nacos, etc.) already provide a UI to edit the configurations, we don't bother to reimplement this kind of feature

title: Agent cannot reconnect OAP
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [√ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
I occasionally find that after the OAP is restarted, the agent can't be reconnected to the OAP for about half an hour. After reading the source code of the agent, I find that the following problems may exist:
1. Multiple threads will report errors and update the connection status. When a certain thread reports an error, it happens that the GRPCChannelManager thread starts scheduling，After changing the connection status to connected, another thread reports an error and changes the status to disconnected. In extreme cases, the agent cannot be reconnected with OAP all the time.
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?
  skywalking 8.1.0
  centos7
- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: liyanyan-dev

comments.body:
> Multiple threads will report errors and update the connection status. When a certain thread reports an error, it happens that the GRPCChannelManager thread starts scheduling，After changing the connection status to connected, another thread reports an error and changes the status to disconnected. In extreme cases, the agent cannot be reconnected with OAP all the time.

How could that be possible if your OAP server is back to healthy, if you OAP server is healthy finally, all the threads should be able to finally change the status to connected. Otherwise there must be something else wrong. Do you have any extra information/logs?

OAP server is healthy, other agent can reconnnect to oap;Only one agent can't reconnect，but restarting the agent is normal .The agent debug log always reports that it is unable to connect and the segment data is ignored;The log file was removed when the agent was restarted

> Only one agent can't reconnect，but restarting the agent is normal.

What's the difference between that agent and the others? Is that agent reproducible always? If yes, can you minimize the codes for us to reproduce this issue and fix?
If it is not connected, it should continue to retry. In this case, can't happen the race condition you described.

comments.body: Is there anything special in the BigData architecture? We support many MQ frameworks, as long as the framework (e.g. Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc.) is in our supported list, their messages should be traced correctly usually. If you meet any problems in real scenario, please provide more context, thanks

title: Does the percentile metrics have concurrency problems
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
If percentile metrics (p50) have been calculated before, the history will be obtained from the storage, and then the update will be done after the calculation.I think there maybe a concurrency problem.
For example A and B get the same metadata at the same time. With their own metadata calculation, the results are different.
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: ieven

comments.body: There is no concurrency case unless the OAP cluster is not stable. We have guaranteed that in the OAP core. No metrics with the same id should be updated from two threads at the same time.

title: How to solve the async callback condition?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
How to solve the async callback condition?

some conditions:

An RPC trigger an external SMS supplier and the service would be received a callback after a few seconds or minutes from the SMS supplier. 
there are maybe 2 traces in the condition.

1. rpc service trigger SMS supplier
2. SMS supplier trigger rpc service.

We can deliver the trace id to the SMS supplier, which is got from the Skywalking toolkit and we can extract the before trace id from the callback.

But how to build the relationship between the 1st trace and the 2nd trace?  And how to monitor the condition?

For this situation in Skywalking support,  I have no idea for now. 
Thx for your help, whether SkyWalking supports this condition.
author: EvanLjp

comments.body: Just trace id is not enough. Like we talked, I still prefer to use collaberate context to do by yourself.

title: alarm's count properties real meaning?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

i see official document and official alarm-setting.yml, count is represent as Frequency of occurrence or time[minute]?
for example:

1、official document 
Count. In the period window, if the number of values over threshold(by OP), reaches count, alarm should send

2、official alarm-setting.yml
  service_sla_rule:
    # Metrics value need to be long, double or int
    metrics-name: service_sla
    op: "<"
    threshold: 8000
    # The length of time to evaluate the metrics
    period: 10
    # How many times after the metrics match the condition, will trigger alarm
    count: 2
    # How many times of checks, the alarm keeps silence after alarm triggered, default as same as period.
    silence-period: 3
    message: **Successful rate of service {name} is lower than 80% in 2 minutes of last 10 minutes**

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: killGC

comments.body:
Consider the period is a moving window caching the metrics. Every minute is a slot in the window. 
Alarm core checks the window every minute. Count means the minimal count of value in the slot over threshold.

> Consider the period is a moving window caching the metrics. Every minute is a slot in the window.
> Alarm core checks the window every minute. Count means the minimal count of value in the slot over threshold.

i understand ,thank you

comments.body: It should be not. Once the instance added, it wouldn't be added again. Untill TTL timer removed it. This duplicate name has been reported in the service level, for me, it looks like some shards are not available somehow, then the OAP core rewrited it again to another index(base on time).

If I deploy the OAP server more than 1，this question  will arise, that's the reason？
Looking forward to your answer, and thanks.

> If I deploy the OAP server more than 1，this question will arise, that's the reason？
> Looking forward to your answer, and thanks.

I deploy 3 OAP server in my cluster, and each service has 3 identical instances.
I think you don't set up the cluster coordinator, but just deploying 3 nodes separately.

thanks, I use k8s coordinator,but I config the the same SKYWALKING_COLLECTOR_UID, I think this is the reason.

thanks again.
@a6205206z Do you solved it?

title: if i deploy cluster nodes with explicit role，how to set SW_AGENT_COLLECTOR_BACKEND_SERVICES on agent side?
body:
OS：CentOS Linux release 7.7.1908 (Core)

Skywalking version：apache-skywalking-apm-es7-8.1.0

I have a three node cluster with the following roles:

node01：SW_ CORE_ ROLE:Receiver

node02：SW_ CORE_ ROLE:Receiver

node03：SW_ CORE_ ROLE:Aggregator

In addition to the role settings of the three nodes, do I need other settings?
How should I set SW_ AGENT_ COLLECTOR_ BACKEND_ SERVICES on agent side？
Please forgive my poor English.
author: shuxiaxia

comments.body: We would recommend you to set a proxy for node01 and node02 as LB. Or you could add both node01 and node02 at the agent config.

author: uu-xixi

No, 8.x uses a brand new protocol, so you have to update both backend and agents, and storage data are not compatible as well (you need to erase the storage data)

title: Oap aggreate role Reading and Writing to  Storage Sepatately  by config
body:
Skywalking need separate reading and writing in storage to improve skywalking oap receive performance
Scene sample : I use ES as storage, In oap server sider, I have 3 receiver and 2 aggregator, the total QPS is about 2k, many agent collect info is neglect. There’s many “No Peer” and “VirtualNode” info in the trace . Then I close all aggregator, the QPS can rise to 6k which is about three times than before. The main reason is aggregate needs many statistic count by ES. Reading influences the writing ability of ES. 
So if separate reading and writing , it will have great performance improvement. ES support reading and writing divid, but skywalking aggregator doesn’t support reading and writing divid( there’s only one storage url config)
author: xfzbw

comments.body: The label is backend \ improment

I totally lost about what you are saying. Very confused. There isn't a performance difference from the two ways of deployments, even the aggregation/receiver separated deployment has better performance from our tests.

> I totally lost about what you are saying. Very confused. There isn't a performance difference from the two ways of deployments, even the aggregation/receiver separated deployment has better performance from our tests.

The two ways of deployments have almost the same performance ,it's right. My question and  requirement is different. Skywalking should have the ablility to  config different storage url  which one is read and one is write ,to impove the storage performance  .
SkyWalking nearly read nothing when doing aggregation. I don't know why this is the project's concern? This is more likely a private requirement.

> SkyWalking nearly read nothing when doing aggregation. I don't know why this is the project's concern? This is more likely a private requirement.

It is true as you say Almost reading nothing when aggregation,but aggregation occupy many resource of the storage like ES, it is very obvious when i close the aggregate   , the deal ability is improve at least times .
Please do not simply regard read as read. Count  \sum  and  some other aggregation functions(action) use many resource(cpu \memory) also should regard as read
Still don't understand, why SkyWalking needs to worry about your private usage. If you don't provide real cases related to SkyWalking itself. There is no point we continue here.

> Still don't understand, why SkyWalking needs to worry about your private usage. If you don't provide real cases related to SkyWalking itself. There is no point we continue here.

Repeat again as my first post content:
Scene sample : I use ES as storage, In oap server sider, I have 3 receiver and 2 aggregator, the total QPS is about 2k, many agent collect info is neglect. There’s many “No Peer” and “VirtualNode” info in the trace . Then I close all aggregator, the QPS can rise to 6k which is about three times than before. The agent side maintain the same before and after the server side adjustment.
I know your description, but so what? If you think mixed role deployment fits you better. Just use it.

> I know your description, but so what? If you think mixed role deployment fits you better. Just use it.

No ,you misunderstanding my meaning,it'st not mix or seperate deployment problem. It's about skywalking should support reading writing storage divided by config. The aggregate role have both  read and write action, aggregate role should have two storage config property row, one is for read (statistic),another for write( the statistic result).  In ES  reading writing seperation is implement by  primary node and copy node ,it cant't write data to copy node .

> I know your description, but so what? If you think mixed role deployment fits you better. Just use it.

In my cases, i shift the skywalking performance three times by  stoping the aggregate node ,only run the receive node . Why there has so large performance improvement,because the aggregate action influence  ES writeing ability.
I shift the skywalking performance three times by stoping the aggregate node ,But aggregate  ability is needed
We don't take the responsibility of explaning the codes. You should read the codes by yourself.

title: the optimization of "trace sql parameters"
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [* ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
When "trace_ sql_parameters" is true, the agent will record the parameters, but if the parameters are too large, the performance will be affected and the memory will be occupied. 
I think it is better to get the truncated parameters string before build the full string of all the parameters.
author: novayoung

comments.body: We have `SQL_PARAMETERS_MAX_LENGTH` from day one, please recheck the doc.

> We have `SQL_PARAMETERS_MAX_LENGTH` from day one, please recheck the doc.

i know that, but truncation depends the full string. 
```
        String parameterString = getParameterString();  // Here is the string of parameters, maybe too large. 
        return truncate(parameterString);
```
OK, if you want to cut the string as soon as it reached the length limitation, you could optimize that.

> OK, if you want to cut the string as soon as it reached the length limitation, you could optimize that.

Ok

I installed the  ES7 +latest version of SkyWalking，when I launch the UI, I go directly to the page without logging in。
If I use it in the company's servers, this is generally not allowed.
So I need a solution that prevents arbitrary access from the outside world.
author: muoushi

comments.body: Please don't submit a duplicated question. We have answered many times, there is no user management. Choose proxy, such as Nginx/APISIX to do that.

	at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)

With jmap we got :
 num     #instances         #bytes  class name
----------------------------------------------
   1:      21632389     2500615320  [C
   2:      20464186     1145994416  org.apache.skywalking.apm.network.register.v2.Endpoint


Any clue please?  thanks!

skywalking-oap 6.3.0

title: Minimal Requirements
body:

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

What is the minimal requirements to run SkyWalking?

I am trying to run SW on a Kubernetes cluster using MySQL as database. I defined OAP server with memory limits equal to 1024Mi and it crashes after ~40min. If I use H2 as database, it crashes after ~5min.

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

7.0.0-es7

- Which company or project?

Private project.

- What happened?

K8s kills pod with status OOMKilled.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: wandersonwhcr

comments.body:
Per document, we statemented the h2 is for demo only. Usually, Java app requires 4~8g as minimal recommended memory.

Also, we recommend you to use v8 for better performance.
TY
