title: when i use @Aspect Annotation in a spring cloud app it has some infos
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [*] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
when i use @Aspect Annotation in a spring cloud app it has some infos , the bootstrap log has some info like 
2020-08-20 20:20:17.034 [main] INFO  org.springframework.aop.framework.CglibAopProxy - Unable to proxy method [final java.lang.String com.timevale.skwka.service.TestController.getMsg$original$aXsk4F1g$accessor$UIVnuXdt(java.lang.String)] because it is final: All calls to this method via a proxy will NOT be routed to the target instance.
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: whfjam

comments.body: Are you using agent to instrument that class and method as well? Please provide the full error stack.

Does this affect your application? This is because we(byte-buddy) added some internal method(final) in your Controller at the runtime. And Spring doesn't support to do `AOP` thing, so this error/warning shows up.

> 
> 
> Does this affect your application? This is because we(byte-buddy) added some internal method(final) in your Controller at the runtime. And Spring doesn't support to do `AOP` thing, so this error/warning shows up.

I think i should learn more about this and test more , then i will tell you about if this could affect my application
Sure, Let's continue after you have more feedback.

This doesn’t effect the application’s logic, it just says the added internal methods cannot be intercepted, but the original one is still there to take effect. According to the codes, I think you only want to print the arguments of the controller, nothing to do with the internal methods added by SkyWalking, right?


I think you should rewrite your pointcut to only intercept methods that are `public` or annotated with `@RequestMapping`(or `@GetMapping` and other similar for POST, ect.), intercepting all methods(including private methods) in a controller is not realistic in a real scenario(it’s very likely that we have private methods in a controller) and I consider it as a bad practice(it costs too much extra and unnecessarily)

title: When sampling is turned on, the @TracecrossThread does not work
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
When sampling is turned on, the @TracecrossThread does not work.
Thread task cannot report, or report two unconnected traces?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?
SkyWalking8.0.0

- Which company or project?

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: lichao0

comments.body:
Because it could be `not-sampled`, that is the side-effect of doing the sampling.

In across-process(RPC/MQ) case, once the plugin uses `public static AbstractSpan createEntrySpan(String operationName, ContextCarrier carrier)`, there is a force sampling mechanism. But for across-thread, there is no such thing.

SkyWalking agent, especially Java agent, recommends you to do backend sampling. Because
1. The above side-effect
1. Metrics would not be accurate

Will back-end sampling lead to higher  load collecter?  
Can across-thread do force sampling mechanism？

> Will back-end sampling lead to higher load collecter?

Network load, yes. Analysis CPU cost, very limited.

> Can across-thread do force sampling mechanism？

I don't know, that depends on the plugin mechanism, some may be possible with agent kernel API adjustment.
Thanks!

comments.body: What do you mean by how to access? We don't set any limitation for this.
I'm sorry, maybe I didn't make it clear. I mean, if I have three links: development, testing and pre release, but I just want to deploy a skywalking service, how will I divide it?
No, we don't have that. Management is not our agenda today.
Does SK not support service partitioning? Do I need to deploy three SK services? dev test pre ....
You could do anything you want. I just say, we don't have that concept. Why need APM in the tesr and dev env? Strange thing.
Because some of our interfaces have to go through pressure test before going online, we hope SK can help us do something.
If you are going to do load test, then use a separate SW cluster. It is recommended.
thank you

title: Request Help : What is the best practice to store ES data for just 7 or 14 days?
body:
- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion

___
### Question
- What is the best practice to store ES data for just 7 or 14 days?
- Is startup env setting `SW_CORE_DAY_METRIC_DATA_TTL: 7` enough?
- Should we `remove` all indices' alias before `DELETE` them?

``` bash
POST /_aliases
{
    "actions": [
        { "remove": { "index": "segment-20200810", "alias": "segment" }}
    ]
}
```
___
### Bug
- docker image version oap : apache/skywalking-oap-server:7.0.0-es7
- k8s deployment of oap :

``` yaml
      containers:
      - name: skywalking-oap
        image: "apache/skywalking-oap-server:7.0.0-es7"
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        env:
        - name: JAVA_OPTS
          value: "-Xmx4g -Xms4g -Dmode=no-init"
        - name: SW_CLUSTER
          value: kubernetes
        - name: SW_CLUSTER_K8S_NAMESPACE
          value: "skywalking-prod"
        - name: SW_CLUSTER_K8S_LABEL
          value: "app=skywalking,release=skywalking-prod,component=skywalking-oap"
        - name: SKYWALKING_COLLECTOR_UID
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.uid
        - name: SW_STORAGE
          value: elasticsearch7
        - name: SW_TRACE_SAMPLE_RATE
          value: "5000"
        - name: SW_CORE_DAY_METRIC_DATA_TTL
          value: "7"
```
author: totemofwolf

comments.body:
We never recommended deleting the index by yourself. What is the background of your question?

TTL is the concept of the period of keeping data alive.

title: SW_CORE_ROLE how to use in production
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
how to use SW_CORE_ROLE in production
___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
i find skywalking lost so many trace on production , and found the oap role.how to use it in production ,and Is there a best practice?
author: EvanLjp

comments.body:
I think this is fully described in the comments.
```
    /**
     * OAP server could work in different roles.
     */
    public enum Role {
        /**
         * Default role. OAP works as the {@link #Receiver} and {@link #Aggregator}
         */
        Mixed,
        /**
         * Receiver mode OAP open the service to the agents, analysis and aggregate the results and forward the results
         * to {@link #Mixed} and {@link #Aggregator} roles OAP. The only exception is for {@link
         * org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.core.analysis.record.Record}, they don't require 2nd round distributed
         * aggregation, is being pushed into the storage from the receiver OAP directly.
         */
        Receiver,
        /**
         * Aggregator mode OAP receives data from {@link #Mixed} and {@link #Aggregator} OAP nodes, and do 2nd round
         * aggregation. Then save the final result to the storage.
         */
        Aggregator
    }
```

l know how the way works.
i want to know the advantage when split 2 parts ,why have this mode.
Is it practical to propose such a solution in what scenarios

When you want a super large OAP cluster, you may need to make network controllable or as planned. This role is helping you to make that. And it isolates the L1 and L2 aggregation, so your cluster performance should be more predictable, they would block each other or face race condition on CPU/thread scheduling.
Is there some experience with the ratio of 2 parts,our applications will create over 900G data everyday. I am facing a very serious loss of behavior now

title: What is the main point of performance loss?
body:
- Why do you submit this issue?
- [✔️ ] Question or discussion
___
### Question
I did a performance test. After adding skywalking agent, the throughput of Java application had a 7% loss, and the sampling rate setting had little impact on the throughput. I would like to ask this question, how do you view this problem: the performance loss has little to do with sampling rate, and what is the main point of performance loss do you think?
author: thanq

comments.body:
7% throughput loss depends on what is your env. Such as it is costed by memory/GC. Sampling basically is about reducing network and serialization costs.
You could check our agent benchmark. The throughput loss is nearly nothing. You need to check this through a different perspective.

title: SelfDuration meaning
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [X] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
I know ```TotalDuration = SelfDuration + duration(s) of child spans.```
but what's meaning of  the SelfDuration Time ?
where is the API latency ? 
what's relation with the API latency and the SelfDuration Time and the TotalDuration Time ?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?
6.4.0
- Which company or project?

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: pingliu

comments.body:
I am afraid, you should learn about Google Dapper Paper and the basic knowledge of span. Once you have that the formula I gave you should be enough. The duration at the left side is the duration of the segment, the segment is the set of spans belonging to one process flow, mostly one HTTP request.

Basically, you need your side study, don't treat us as a service provider, which we are not. Open-source community is collaborating with developers, preaching is evangelists', consultant, or commercial services' responsibility.

author: wlyu

comments.body: Currently NO. We only provide abstract concepts, in order to adopt different JVM models.

title: What is the latest version of Skywalking that supports tomcat 6 JRE6
body:
I have several old projects running on tomcat6 JRE6 to connect to Skywalking.

First question:
What is the **latest version of Skywalking that supports JRE6 tomcat 6**?

Second question:
Can I use the **old version of Skywalking agent that supports tomcat6 JRE6** to connect to **the lastest version of  Skywalking server**?
author: minlywang

comments.body: We never had plugin in Tomcat 6 as far as I known. It is too old. About the JRE6, I think SkyWalking 7 and the previous version should work, but still, no Tomcat 6 plugin. You may could try SpringMVC plugin, to see whether you have luck.

title: It's hard to distinguish business exception and other errors with Error status filter on the trace page
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion

___
### Question

It 's common to use global exception handler in spring. We can throw the all business exceptions in controller, and catch it by a custom ExceptionHandler with ControllerAdvice annotation. 

With the springmvc plugin in agent, it will mark the status of span to error, even though the 200 http status is returned in the global exception handler. In this case, If we choose Error status on the trace page, there are lots of traces with business exception, and it's hard to get more useful errors like 4xx, 5xx and so on.

Is there any good way in this case?
author: momo0313

comments.body:
> It 's common to use global exception handler in spring. We can throw the all business exceptions in controller, and catch it by a custom ExceptionHandler with ControllerAdvice annotation.

I can't agree it is common or right. Controlling the workflow by exception is rude and low-performance. 
But if you do that, you have to change the source codes on your own. SkyWalking wouldn't take that responsibility because if we do so, we have to check every exception and iterate its parent, it will burn the agent in heavy traffic systems. If you know where to do the filter, change the codes.

@wu-sheng
Is it possible to add a config properties on agent side, such as:  

span.status.check.exclude.exceptions: BusinessException,XXException
span.status.check.include.exceptions: RuntimeException,XXException

If the user want to focus on some custom exceptions, they can get more useful infos by filter Error status of trace.

title: how to deal with dynamic urls when registry lots of endpoints
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [1] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
there is a scene,in springcloud, zuul gateway router dynamic urls to business springboot application, agent will  registry lots 
 of endpoints to oap server periodly,oap server will put the endpoint into localcache or es.but the endpoints are too much ,it will take quite a few time to deal with them .when the cahe size is not enough,a lot of requests will hit the es storage  and it will low down the performance of the oap server,in sometime maybe make the server oom. is there any way to solve the problem? 
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?
6.6
- Which company or project?
autoai.com
- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.
 zuul gateway router dynamic urls to business springboot application
___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
agent group rule for dynamic urls
author: xiaofeitu2

comments.body: In 8+, there is no register, so, don't need to worry about this. And backend url grouping has been provided. Don't do this in the agent, it will be a high load for your app.

1. dose that mean in 6.x version it is difficult to solve the problem?
2.in 8+,will all the operationame be recorded in es or other storage ? every time get the endpoint name or id will request the stroage and if there are lots of different endpoint name to request and quiet frequently,  if we add a choice that putting the endpoint name in distribute cache system ,will that be possible?

> dose that mean in 6.x version it is difficult to solve the problem?

Yes, it is hard. That is why we changed the design.

> in 8+,will all the operationame be recorded in es or other storage ? 

Still in ES, but no register, so no block you are facing. And no endpoint cache anymore. If you want to know more details, read the latest codes.

> every time get the endpoint name or id will request the stroage and if there are lots of different endpoint name to request and quiet frequently, if we add a choice that putting the endpoint name in distribute cache system ,will that be possible?

It is possible, but not helpful. It still cost too much. We don't think that is a good idea. Anyway, the better way is provided, let's not stuck in the old design. High level design improvement is always better than purely tech level improvement.

title: Endpoint throughput data in skywalking and data with Jmeter voltage measurement throughput
body: Why is the endpoint throughput data in skywalking very different from the data measured with Jmeter press? Which data is more accurate and reasonable? Is the throughput of the endpoints in useful skywalking used as a stress indicator data and written on the performance test report?
author: kongyu20

comments.body: That could be many reasons, such as your ES cluster capability, whether in cluster mode, and whether cluster mode config correctly. It is hard to tell from your single one sentence question.
Endpoint throughput data in skywalking is about 10 times the Jmeter voltage dating data
Are you reading what I replied? You are keeping saying the same thing. Without your local research, we can't help.
Sorry, I see what you mean. Explain the advance condition, skywalking is in ES cluster mode, and the agent data sampling rate is the default configuration.
Is SkyWalking in cluster mode? Are you config correctly?

The skywalking service itself is not a cluster mode. As for most configurations are defaulted, there are several xxxMaxSize configuration items with values that are larger than the default adjustment.Reference to the official website and some technical blog configuration, to tell the truth whether this configuration is correct is really a question.

I don't know what you changed. Please explain in detailly. Also, OAP server has fail-safe mechanism, once it can't process or ES can't process the throughput, even you set 100% sampling on the agent, some data will be ignored on the agent side directly.

comments.body: It exists in es6 storage only. The documentation indicated this.
@wu-sheng  thanks, Is this will supported in  skywalking version 8.0.0 ?

No, it is an experimental feature only(as doc said too). Unless, there are contributors who will focus on these features, and enhance them for product ready,  no committer is working on this. More and more people move on SkyWalking native agents already and has no plan to do so, as far as I known. Sorry.

title: Skywalking java integration
body:
Hi Please help on the java integration of Skywalking. I have gone through some documentation and tried to install the app. I am able to install the app and run the UI of Skywalking, but I am not able to integrate my java program with it.

Please suggest with some good doc or steps.

Thank you.
author: cnu753718835-seelam

comments.body: What do you mean by some documents?

title: How to install Apache skywalking in centos machine?
body:
Hi,

I want to install apache skywalking tool in my environment where my application is in nodejs(frontend),tomcat(backend) and databases as oracle.

I have tried with pinpoint tool but they are not supporting the Nodejs so i'm looking for this tool as potential of my application.
Currently i'm using kubernetes deployment for my application.
I want to install skywalking on one separate machine and installing/associating agent in my kubernetes deployed application for tracing.
Could you please help me to install skywalking? 
Any installation guide which i can follow to install skywalking?

Thank you.
author: subusharma2001

comments.body:
The nodejs agent has its own tepo, out of ASF. Lrase check there.
The backend doesn't require OS, as an Java application. We have links for doc for quick start in the github readme and website.

comments.body: You put logs with your own app, which is impossible to be understood by us. This thing should not work in this way. I recommend you to check the error reason, and what is conflict with your codes.
That is nothing. Just some classes emhanced and methods intercepted by SkyWalking agent.

title: Does skywalking agent support Intercepting JDK built-in classes?
body:
- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question

Hi, dear developers.

I'm trying to explore more abilities of skywalking agent. Does it support Intercepting the built-in classes like `java.util.HashMap#containsKey` or `java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor#getCorePoolSize`?
author: liuhaoXD

comments.body:
I tried to intercept the  `java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor` class and got an exception:

```

This is not about skywalking, this is about the codes. Please think the logic, if your agent is using the classes, how could you enhance them? Your example is this case.

For your question, yes, we can. Check the bootstrap plugin, we are enhancing some of the JDK rt.jar classes.

title: skywalking print error in biz log
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?
Version 6.6.0  in jdk 1.8 and centos 7.0

- Which company or project?
koolearn

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.
I found some no class found some error in my application biz log(not in skywalking agent log), then I download the agent jar in product machine and decompile the jar found the class exists. 

```

title: high cpu consume when big sql execute
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [x] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
in Production Environment， we set the agent config with the parameter 
 ：plugin.mysql.trace_sql_parameters= true ；
but when  insert batch records ，the skywalking take  high cpu consume，that make our application slower。Why to build the parameter take  high cpu consume？
author: codhealer

comments.body:
Two things, 
1. Long SQL statements mean more parameters, more parameters mean more interceptions happen, which cause CPU, and more memory means more CPU on GC.
1. Segment in the preparation stage before sending to the backend, it causes more resources(memory and CPU) and when sending happens, more network used.

People used to keep asking for tracing parameter, we always said, don't do that. But as people kept requesting, we added this as an option parameter. So people should consider why we don't put this as default.

title: Any plan for Jaeger receiver to support Analysis mode?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [X ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- We are planning to add tracing for a C++ project.  Besides tracing, we want the additional APM functions which Skywalking provides. However,  skywalking doesn't have a C++ client library at this moment. Thus, we would like to use Jaegar C++ client library to collect the tracing data and send it to Skywalking. Howerver, Skywalking Jaeger receiver doesn't support  Analysis mode, which means we cannot use the additional APM functions which Skywalking provides. 
Now we are wondering is there any plan for Jaeger receiver to support Analysis mode?

Thanks!
author: ArronD

comments.body:
Analysis trace from zipkin or jaeger is not a high performance. We only have experimental Zipkin trace analysis. It is only working in no cluster mode. 

see #2653 for more details and context. Jaeger and Zipkin are sharing the same issue.
Thanks for your reply！

Hi, Skywalking occurs a problem In the production environment.The traceId sometimes shows "Ignored Trace", sometimes is  normal. The request url is the same and one the same instance.The only difference is the request time is not the same.I checked the source code, but did not find the cause. author: thomasbryant1024

comments.body:
This thing should be in 2 cases
1. Agent sampling opened.
1. The codes processing Thread models are not same, even in the same endpoint.

Of course, a bug could cause this, But in most cases, the bug is actually caused by 2.

> This thing should be in 2 cases
> 
> 1. Agent sampling opened.
> 2. The codes processing Thread models are not same, even in the same endpoint.
> 
> Of course, a bug could cause this, But in most cases, the bug is actually caused by 2.

Agent sampling closed，I have checked the agent config and OAP receiver config before
Ignore is rarely to see in 100% sampling, in most cases, even there is bug, it doesn't show ignored trace.

> Ignore is rarely to see in 100% sampling, in most cases, even there is bug, it doesn't show ignored trace.

so that is so odd, the interval of the two call with the same url is  almost two minutes, so the concurrency problem will be excluded ...I will try to debug locally and add more skywalking log in pro env tomorrow. If I still can not find the cause , then  ask for  help later
I could share the understanding in the code level, cocurrency doesn't affect the sampling or ignorance.

> I could share the understanding in the code level, cocurrency doesn't affect the sampling or ignorance.

OK.thx a lot

Yes , in my case too 。  if the agent config a uncorrect oap Server address , or unable to. connect to the correct oap Server  . 

the Trace_id will. return. **Ignored_Trace** ！！！

how to fix:
config the correct oap server  address 。  

`collector.backend_service=${SW_AGENT_COLLECTOR_BACKEND_SERVICES:127.0.0.1:11800}
`
How did you finally solve this problem?

> How did you finally solve this problem?

1. Confirm that skywalking has started normally.
2. Confirm that the back-end address of agent configuration is correct。Parameter is "collector.backend_service="

title: Is skywalking define trace-info protocol itself?
body:
(1)Agent send trace-info(TraceSegment) to OAPServer(by grpc or http).TraceSegment is a opentracing-skeleton only，but the info detail is define by skywalking itself,real?
eg: Trace-info of ZipKin is different between skywalking?  
(2) What the package "apm-toolkit-opentracing" doing for ? Can trace-info of skywalking transform to other  framework?

Thanks
author: yaoyuandota

comments.body:
Your description is wrong. Trace segment is SkyWalking protocol and daya structure. We have nothing related to opentracing, except the toolkit to provide some compatible APIs only. We have clear protocol document to describe ours.

Our protocol is designed for APM, Zipkin is especially for tracing. We have much difference.

opentracing toolkit is providing limited APIs for users to interact with the agent.

title: several services that have no connection，but there's a connection in the topology diagram
body: Hello, there's a problem. Skywalking7-es7 and sofa RPC are used for microservices. There are several services that have no connection, including in the tracking interface. There's no connection to view the service alone, but there's a connection in the topology diagram. What's the reason？Thank you
author: longdevops332

comments.body: Is there relationship between services or not? Please make yourself clear.
There are several services that do not have any connection at all, so there is something wrong with the topology map

In addition, I call all traceids of a service in skywalking's tracking module through Python program according to the link in question in the topology diagram. Query query trace ($traceid: ID!). In the result ["data"] ["trace"] ["spans"], all the statistics are made and no associated service is found in the topology diagram, so it's strange.

Are they sharing the same network address, including port? If so, the alias could be set wrong. 

We don't have python sdk in the open source world, so, if you are doing something internally, it is very hard to find out what is the issue.
It's not a python SDK. I'm a python crawler mode. I grab the spans corresponding to all traceids related to the service. I find that there is no problem associated service in the topology map

> It's not a python SDK. I'm a python crawler mode. I grab the spans corresponding to all traceids related to the service. I find that there is no problem associated service in the topology map

Then we are back to the IP issue. Do you have a chance A->B and C->D are using the same `ip:port`/`hostname`/`domain name`/anything at A and C sides?

I use services with different namespaces in k8s, and we have no connection at the code level. Env mode is used in pods to communicate with skywalking, [and each SW agent name is unique]

{"name": "SW_AGENT_NAMESPACE","value": "test" }, {"name": "SW_AGENT_NAME","value": "xx-user-biz-app"},{ "name": "SW_AGENT_COLLECTOR_BACKEND_SERVICES", "value": "xx.xx.xx.xx:11800"}
Agent namespace doesn't affect the backend analysis, if you are sharing the OAP backend cluster, you need to make sure the IP is duplicated.

Excuse me, I found a strange phenomenon. Today at 10:00, skywalking is built in a completely new environment; ES7 is also new. It has no data at all. After that, it will collect more than one hour's data and view the service topology map. If the time node is selected as the latest day, the effect of the topology map is correct. However, if the latest week is selected, there are some services in the topology map that do not have a connection at all, which actually shows a connection. I'm surprised that since it's the new one installed today, shouldn't the topology map display the same in the last day and the last week

Can't tell much from your description, I recommend you to read the topology build logic, then we could discuss online at our bi-weekly meeting, if you want.

Next Tuesday night is the next meeting. Subscribe to our mail list, you will receive the nofitication.

title: The service throughput does not match the instance throughput
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

  - Skywalking 6.5
  - Centos 6
  - JDK8

- What happen?

  Under the Tab of the service, we found the value of the service throughput did not match the value of the running serviceinstance.

  Sample Service have 7 instances and their CPM at 14:45 is as follows:
  - 21791
  - 10926
  - 10923
  - 10919
  - 10915
  - 10913
  - 10908

  The total is 87,295 cpm,but in service throughput is 66,714.

  And in the instance Tab, each instance throughput curve is flat, but under the service Tab, there are often have very low values.
author: Yuanruitao

comments.body: Do you set the enough bulk size? Otherwise, the data could be lost in some cases.
This size could reach 2000 as the max, if you have many endpoints and services.

oap log: 
- Bulk execution id [41824] completed in 185 milliseconds, size: 2000
- Synchronous bulk took time: 2118 millis, size: 5788
- Bulk execution id [41825] completed in 50 milliseconds, size: 435
- Bulk execution id [41826] completed in 190 milliseconds, size: 2000
- Synchronous bulk took time: 2146 millis, size: 5519
- Bulk execution id [41827] completed in 170 milliseconds, size: 2000
- Bulk execution id [41828] completed in 78 milliseconds, size: 858
- Synchronous bulk took time: 2079 millis, size: 5468

Should I set bulk size to 8000?

How this turns to 5000+? Is there a bug somehow? I don't have time to dig deeper yet.
Do you do some debugs?
I am work for it now , I will reply if there is any result.
Oh, I realized I reading codes wrong, so basically, yes, you need 8000 as bulk size.
Ok, thanks. I'll test if it helpful.

> Bulk execution id [41826] completed in 190 milliseconds, size: 2000

This is the real flush size. Set to 2000 or `storage/elasticsearch/bulkActions` value.

> Synchronous bulk took time: 2079 millis, size: 5468

This is the size in a timer persistent period only, it just shows you how many rows inserted/updated.

So I am sure for now, choose 2000.

Back to the questions, Dose it mean bulk size is enough?
> Do you set the enough bulk size? Otherwise, the data could be lost in some cases.

Other problems caused the loss of data.
Thank for your help,  I will keep looking for reason.
2000 is the suitable value, if you set larger than this, should be fine.

Solved!
The problem is my grpc config no IP binding. 
If oap is in cluster mode, the "code.default.gRPCHost" config can not be "0.0.0.0".
Thanks for the feedback.

title: Force flushing collected traces
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion

___
### Question

I'm creating a test that involves running code and verifying the traces which were sent to OAP are what's expected. I'm able to accomplish this if I run code more than necessary to make sure enough time has passed and enough traces have been sent to the OAP server.

For example, in my test I run:
```groovy
for (int i = 0; i < 40; i++) { //notice calling 40 times
    TraceTest.threeStaticMethodCallDepth() //<- this method is traced by agent
}
```

After this, I can query the OAP server with `queryBasicTraces` and a `pageSize` of `10`. This works great.

However, if I instead run:
```groovy
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) { //notice only calling 10 times
    TraceTest.threeStaticMethodCallDepth()
}
```

When I query the OAP server with `queryBasicTraces` and a `pageSize` of `10`, I can only find `2` results.

---

I've tried adding a listener like:
```groovy
def traceAsync = test.async(10)
def listener = new TracingContextListener() {
    void afterFinished(TraceSegment traceSegment) {
        traceAsync.countDown()
    }
}
TracingContext.ListenerManager.add(listener)

for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    TraceTest.threeStaticMethodCallDepth()
}
```

This only results in `afterFinished` being called three times though.

---

My question is, how can I set up my agent so that it will force flush traces to the OAP server or what can I run to wait until those traces have been sent out?
author: BFergerson

comments.body: Are you trying to interact with the segment sender of agent? Could you provide more context about in which case, which parts of codes are doing this?
Currently, there is no way to do this, that is why in our E2E, we only could set up the timeout for this.

### Question
I am using skywalking in product environment,  this are 9 receivers and 9 aggregators in skywalking cluster and the elastic search cluster has 12 nodes, every node has 24 CPU and every node`s heap memory is 30G. title: some query and monitoring features
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [x] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
1、In our system, a request will have many redis queries; so in the tracking chain query interface, there will be many jedis records in the list. How to filter out these records and only display other related content。
2、Can the apm agent track a thread with a high CPU usage and push an alarm  event  containing the thread-related traceId , via mq or other methods. In this way, we can monitor the event and limit the request resource corresponding to the traceId, or even the user request.
author: codhealer

comments.body:
> 1、In our system, a request will have many redis queries; so in the tracking chain query interface, there will be many jedis records in the list. How to filter out these records and only display other related content。

You could remove redis plugin.

> 2、Can the apm agent track a thread with a high CPU usage and push an alarm event containing the thread-related traceId , via mq or other methods. In this way, we can monitor the event and limit the request resource corresponding to the traceId, or even the user request.

1. CPU alert, yes, you could set the rule to cpu related metrics. 
1. Trace id has nothing related to this. CPU is not thread-level metrics. I think you have wrong concept about the metrics and trace id relationship.

Regarding the second question，Under Linux, we can get the top-related thread id through the ps command, which corresponds to the thread id of the JVM stack, and then find the corresponding traceId value through the thread variable.
[linux command : ps aux | sort -k3nr | head -n 10 ]
Can we collude this process through apm agent？
There is no thread-related CPU in the JVM MBean, as far as I known.
Thanks for answering

### Bug

- Which company or project?

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: dengliming

comments.body: What kind of compressed do you mean?

Question should go to mail list. 

Mail list: dev@skywalking.apache.org. Mail to dev-subscribe@skywalking.apache.org, follow the reply to subscribe the mail list.
like gzip?

Currently no, because from previous HTTP experience, this is a very tricky issue. If gzip is on, the CPU will be burn, and the network load actually wouldn't reduce much. But we haven't tested this in the gRPC case. 

We are welcome you to do the tests and post the result, if the result is positive in some cases, we are welcome to accept the gzip pull request from you.
Got it, Thanks. I will send question by email next time.

comments.body:
You need to try debug the plugin, and find out why npe. And recheck with the master codes.
We have plugin Tests cases, Please cross check with them too. Maybe some cases are missed there.

title: The TOPN record in the database, what conditions will be recorded?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ * ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

The TOPN record in the database, what conditions will be recorded?

Through the tracking page, you can see that a certain URL has a database operation. However, there is no record in the  database TOPN record page.

Is it because sql executes too fast?

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

TopN数据库记录，什么条件会被记录？

通过追踪页面可以看到某个url 有数据库操作。但是，在database TOPN record 页面里并没有记录。

是因为sql执行的太快了吗？
author: big-loser

comments.body: Yes. Read the top threshold setting document.

> Yes. Read the top threshold setting document.

thank you for your reply.

title: why  can't set agent.namespace  by Chinese language?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: lsy1990

comments.body: When I set this var agent.namespace  value to chinese language,all api will failed ,can't registry to eruka.
Is there some special setting ?
Simple answer is, we are not expecting the namespace is Chinese. If you want, you basically need to fix the encoding issue.

### Bug

Skywalking-6.4.0

The pom.xml of sharding-sphere-4.x-plugin dependency configration as bellow:
```xml
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.shardingsphere</groupId>
            <artifactId>sharding-core-execute</artifactId>
            <version>[4.0.0-RC1,5.0.0)</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
```
`ShardingExecuteDataMap` class path is `org.apache.shardingsphere.core.execute.ShardingExecuteDataMap` at version 4.0.0-RC1 to 4.0.0-RC3, however, from version 4.0.0 the path was changed to `org.apache.shardingsphere.core.execute.engine.ShardingExecuteDataMap`.

title: Can skywalking exclude specified Exception？
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
In my project, developer defined BusinessException for some senerio such as parameter validate、bussiness logic validate，these exceptions are printed，but does not mean endpoint failure. 
In skywalking，these situation are calulated for service success rate metric.Is there any way I can config, in order to exclude the BusinessException ?
author: CodeDestiny

comments.body:
No, we can't. Using exception to propagate error is not a good idea, and have bad performance. 
Please consider to remove them.
The exception is dealt with in the plugin, If you insist, you have to change plugins one by one.
Because in last company，we used OneAPM which can config this，but also thanks a lot

OneAPM product did very different way. They Even can't 100% sampling, Even far from it. We are different.
Again, this can be added If some one wants to contribute.

title: CICD improvement
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [x] Feature or performance improvement
___
### Requirement or improvement

there is the description in english:

skywalking didn't feel the best solution in CICD, event feel confused, In fact, the support of skywalking in kubernetes has bean very good
skywalking's current practice:
	use submodules to include other modules in to top-level project
	CICD files with other subprojects declared in the docker directory, there is a problem, top-level projects cannot use source data provided by git itself to version multipart subprojects, it cause a lot of manual wor
let each subproject manage CICD, formation automation, provice a version correspondence table in the upper-level project, the records in the table are written in chronlogicial order, use for polymerization in the upper layer
the main contradiction is that the version of the subproject and the vesion of the upper layer  cannot be connected in series, unless the version has contains features, ant in the CICD process, it can directly connect the lower layer in the upper layer

这里是中文描述:

skywalking在CICD这块感觉没有做到最佳方案, 甚至感觉很混乱, 实际上skywalking在kubernetes的支持已经做到非常非常好了
目前做法:
	在顶层项目使用子模块将其他模块包含起来
	在docker目录中声明了其他子项目的CICD文件, 这样有一个问题, 顶层项目无法使用git本身提供的源数据对多个子项目的版本, 这就造成了大量的手工工作
让各个子项目各自管理CICD, 形成自动化, 在上层项目中提供版本对应表, 表中记录按照时间顺序编写记录, 在上层进行进行聚合使用

主要矛盾就是子项目的版本和上层的版本无法串联起来, 除非版本也有包含功能, 并且在CICD过程中能够在上层直接串联起下层
author: tristan-tsl

comments.body: @tristan-tsl  Totally confused what you're talking about, even though you have a Chinese version and I'm working in a CI/CD team, your opinion is too vague to catch up

> CICD files with other subprojects declared in the docker directory

First thing confusing me is this, what are the CICD files? We never have such thing.

@tristan-tsl I used to work at Huawei HQ CI/CD department, @kezhenxu94 is working on Alibaba CI/CD team. And both of us are familiar with the SkyWalking. So, I think this is not our background issue.

The only guess I have, is you may have some misunderstanding about SkyWalking project structure. Especially when you said CI/CD, where is the CD? This is an open source environment, we have no where to deploy anything to anybody.
The second one is what do you mean subproject? And which subproject do you refer? SkyWalking has a long repository list including sub projects and sub modules. We need you to clarify this too.
After offline discussion, this topic doesn't make sense to the community. I am closing it.

title: Application will not quit after main() done
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
Here is the example, assume that we have a class `Hello` as defined here

```java
public class Hello {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello, World!");
    }
}
```

after doing this

```bash
 java -javaagent:skywalking-agent.jar Hello
```
we should got `Hello, World!` at terminal stdout, and then the application should quit with status code `0` (which means process quit without any errors)

However, what I got is:
1. the stdout is ok
2. the application KEEPS RUNNING until I trigger `CTRL-C`.  

Maybe it's a normal circumstance when some non-daemon background threads are still running, but it's still quite a wired phenomenon where the application has done it's work and keeps running without any response for common developer.
___

- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.

From my point of view, as an agent, all threads should be daemon? @wu-sheng

title: when use the gateway-agent and trace-ignore-agent. the "/actuator/health" can not be ignored!
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
Bug
___
### Bug
6.6.0

- What happen?
when use the gateway-agent and trace-ignore-agent. the "/actuator/health" can not be ignored!

i configed the ignore_config   "/actuator/**",but it not worked,but in other application, it worked.
only in gateway, it not worked!
author: Keanhua

comments.body:
This need your local test and debug. The plugin is coming from the 200+contributors, we can't tell all the details.
I just could share with you, the `ignore` plugin only works for the first span name of the tracing context, so make sure that is the right operation name.

title: Is 6.6 oap cluster can receive  trace from 6.5 Agent ？
body:
### Question
- What do you want to know?
Is 6.6 oap cluster can receive  trace from 6.5 Agent .
I update my cluster from 6.5 to 6.6. But  some agent is 6.5 。
The oap clusters  can run . But some trace is bad. Service can not show right name ,It it show VNode....
author: seifeHu

comments.body:
I don't think that is related to 6.5->6.6. It is compatible, and agent should be able hot reboot if you erase all data int the storage.

I am not sure what do you mean bad. VNode is a UI enhancement to tell you, some part of the traces has not been reported.

> compatible, and agent should be able hot reboot if you erase all data int the storage.

I delete all index just now . It is  works 
tks .

have you solved this problem?

我解决了这个问题，因为Consul需要与客户端做健康检查，所以必须要告诉Consul本机地址与Ip，请看配置：
```
  consul:
    serviceName: ${SW_SERVICE_NAME:"SkyWalking_OAP_Cluster"}
    hostPort: ${SW_CLUSTER_CONSUL_HOST_PORT:10.0.0.1:8500,10.0.0.2:8500,10.0.0.3:8500}
    internalComHost: 172.xxx.xxx #告诉Consul本节点Ip
    internalComPort: 11800  #告诉Consul这个是健康检查的端口
```

> 我解决了这个问题，因为Consul需要与客户端做健康检查，所以必须要告诉Consul本机地址与Ip，请看配置：
>

>     internalComHost: 172.xxx.xxx #告诉Consul本节点Ip
>     internalComPort: 11800  #告诉Consul这个是健康检查的端口
> ```

可以解决这个问题，但是有些不配置也可以，搞不懂！

title: multiple endpoints will be created if has path variable in URL
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [X] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
Hi, we have an api which url is /find/{userId}/{companyId}. When this api is called with different id, a new endpoint instance will be persisted in endpoint inventory. Is there any solution to avoid this problem? We just want to treat it as one endpoint.
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: f02061232-1

comments.body: Is this your private framework? SpringMVC has dealt with this case.
It's a spring boot project.
SpringMVC will fetch the path automatically, if you have set the parameter({param}) in the controller path.

> SpringMVC will fetch the path automatically, if you have set the parameter({param}) in the controller path.

I also have the same problem. the url is /api/userCrowd/{adSystem}/{userId}, while the result has two kind of endpoints. /api/userCrowd/{adSystem}/{userId} and /api/userCrowd/YT/001, the throughput of the service is double of the requests. Is there any properties to set to fix this problem?

>  Is there any properties to set to fix this problem?

Maybe you are using webflux as web container? If so, remove the plugin.

> > Is there any properties to set to fix this problem?
> 
> Maybe you are using webflux as web container? If so, remove the plugin.

Thanks for reply. In my project I use undertow as the embed container in springboot. when I switch to tomcat, the problem is fixed.
Then simply remove the undertow plugin, because of the async http framework, two entry span detected, that is why the CPM is not accurate.

title: 【spring-data-redis】默认使用io.lettuce，调用链未追踪到redis。改为jedis可以，请问是为啥
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion

___
### Question
- 【spring-data-redis】默认使用io.lettuce，调用链未追踪到redis。改为jedis后可以正常显示。

___
### Bug
- Skywalking version: 6.6.0

- What happen?
【spring-data-redis: 2.2.1】默认使用io.lettuce: lettuce-core: 5.2.1 ，调用链未追踪到redis的访问。
改为jedis后可以正常显示，请问问题出在哪？希望使用lettuce时能正常工作，谢谢！

【default lettuce】

       <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-data-redis</artifactId>
        </dependency>

【jedis】

      <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-data-redis</artifactId>
            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>io.lettuce</groupId>
                    <artifactId>lettuce-core</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>redis.clients</groupId>
            <artifactId>jedis</artifactId>
        </dependency>

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion

- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

### Question
This is to understand skywalking.

I'm new to skywalking. I want to understand how data as a whole sent to h2. Anyone naming the files to be looked after will be much helpful.
author: sujithkumar28

comments.body: `MetricsPersistentWorker` for metrics, topology, and topN. `RecordStreamProcessor` for traces.
H2 is just an implementation of storage.
Thanks a lot for your reply. I'm trying to store the metrics into a file as json. Is there a guide to debug skywalking agent? Can the datacarrier object be made a json
No. Basically, the thing doesn't work in this way. SkyWalking is an APM system, not as simply as you described.

Sorry!! If that was simply explained. I do understand that this is a very complex system that is developed, which made me curious to understand the underlying deatails. I've put my requirements in simple words. As far as my understand,the trace and method metrics are passed on to H2. Since we don't have a H2 console enabled and as I'm facing issues with configuring external h2. I just wanted to look at the raw data rather than UI. since I'm new to instrumentation I've put forth my requirements in simple words. I really appreciate your patience and quick replies. Thank you
If you want the outline, read the protocol documents, which could set the boundaries.

This scenario blocked me a lot that, as a Java dev, we always open & monitor 8080 to offer our backend service, but, when I need to deploy skywalking the same node with my service, I have no idea but changing my port of service from 8080 to other one (e.g. 8081), so that I can access the skywalking UI then

And, I searched the config files & other online doc, but no one else can tell the stable way to change this config. 

So, my question is, is it able to change the default UI port of skywalking from 8080 to others instead of  modify the code and re-complie it?

CATALINA_OPTS="$CATALINA_OPTS -javaagent:/home/admin/agent/skywalking-agent.jar";export CATALINA_OPTS
English only

Because English is for everyone

title: What's the usage of network_address_inventory and where its data come from?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [X] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

I'm trying to create a sla report base on skywalking service_sla_day data. What confused me is that lots of services come from network address inventory. These services is not registered to skywalking by ourselves. I read md file, but got limited information.

For Network Address Inventory, it represents all network address, in IP:port, hostname, domain name formats, which are detected by language agents or other probes.

eg:
{
                "_index":"service_inventory",
                "_type":"type",
                "_id":"1_56",
                "_score":0,
                "_source":{
                    "sequence":68,
                    "heartbeat_time":1574781959840,
                    "node_type":3,
                    "mapping_last_update_time":1574782809172,
                    "name":"service-provider:80",
                    "address_id":56,
                    "is_address":1,
                    "mapping_service_id":64,
                    "register_time":1574781956854,
                    "properties":null
                }
            }

we are using javaagent -javaagent:apache-skywalking-apm-bin/agent/skywalking-agent.jar, how did this agent detect above Network Address (service-provider:80) or service and add to service_inventory index?
author: f02061232-1

comments.body: If You want to understand this. You need to understand the topology detection. I am trying to write a paper about this, But it is not published yet. You need to read codes.

title: How should database access and JVM instance alert rules be configured?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- How should database access and JVM instance alert rules be configured? 
  

```
# database metrics
  database_access_resp_time_rule:
    metrics-name: database_access_resp_time
    op: ">"
    threshold: 1000
    period: 10
    count: 3
    silence-period: 5
    message: Response time of database {name} is more than 1000ms in 3 minutes of last 10 minutes.
  database_access_sla_rule:
    metrics-name: database_access_sla
    op: "<"
    threshold: 8000
    period: 10
    count: 2
    silence-period: 3
    message: Successful rate of database {name} is lower than 80% in 2 minutes of last 10 minutes.

# JVM metrics
  instance_jvm_cpu_rule:
    metrics-name: instance_jvm_cpu
    op: ">"
    threshold: 60
    period: 10
    count: 2
    silence-period: 3
    message: JVM instances have been used more than 80% in the last 2 minutes.
  instance_jvm_young_gc_time_rule:
    metrics-name: instance_jvm_young_gc_time
    op: ">"
    threshold: 100
    period: 10
    count: 3
    silence-period: 5
    message: JVM Young GC time.
  instance_jvm_young_gc_count_rule:
    metrics-name: instance_jvm_young_gc_count
    op: ">"
    threshold: 1
    period: 10
    count: 3
    silence-period: 5
    message: JVM Young GC count.

```
author: zjie0723

comments.body: Service instance related GC/CPU metrics have been added into alarm context. So, these alarm rules should work. At the same time, the DB Access isn't, so, it would be triggered in the alarm core.

it means that if I upgrade OAP Server(6.4 to 6.6)，I must also upgrade all agents version as well.
is it correct?

ex: UI 6.6 query against OAP Server 6.4

UI and OAP have query protocol too. skywalking-query-protocol.

title: I can shorten elasticsearch index name
body:
I wanted to use elassandra's elasticsearch feature on this project and integrate skywalking link tracking to discover this problem.I used the skywalking version is apache-skywalking-apm-6.5.0.

[cassandra] Both keyspace and table name should be comprised of only alphanumeric characters, cannot be empty and are limited in size to 48 characters (that limit exists mostly to avoid filenames (which may include the keyspace and table name) to go over the limits of certain file systems). By default, keyspace and table names are case insensitive (myTable is equivalent to mytable) but case sensitivity can be forced by using double-quotes ("myTable" is different from mytable).

Below is the error log

author: huangkaiyan10

comments.body: Could you share which storage are you using?

@huangkaiyan10 so Cassandra ElasticSearch is a variation of ElasticSearch? If you must use Cassandra ElasticSearch, I think you may need to find out how to cancel the limitations on key space length on Cassandra side, at least, I don’t think we’ll provide another storage type specifically for this variation, will we @wu-sheng ? If the only difference is indices name length, maybe a config item to shorten the names, but it really needs investigation on the differences.

> Could you share which storage are you using?

Cassandra as a store for elasticsearch. Cassandra has a limitation, Keyspace and table name are limited in size to 48 characters (that limit exists mostly to avoid filenames (which may include the keyspace and table name) to go over the limits of certain file systems)

@kezhenxu94  Cassandra as a store for elasticsearch. Cassandra has a limitation, Keyspace and table names are limited in size to 48 characters (that limit exists mostly to avoid filenames (which may include the keyspace and table name) to go over the limits of certain files Systems). Settings are not currently provided to resolve this issue

We don't have that, as we even don't know this use case. But how do you expect to make the name shorter? Most names are defined in OAL and widely used UI, CLI and many 3rd party systems, even commercial production. 

Could you indicate what you want to do?
@wu-sheng use Cassandra as a store for elasticsearch.
I know that part, I mean what do you want to change in your mind? Simply changing the name is very hard to be accepted by the community. And you will break a lot of things.
@wu-sheng if I want use Cassandra as a store ，the name is limited in size to 48 characters 。cassandra's Keyspace and table names are limited in size to 48 characters .
I have already known that. But my question is, what do you want from us? Clearly, we are impossible to change all names to follow your requirements, they are bounded in the codes everywhere.
Any further discussion?

title: how to use service mesh and native probe at the same time
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [yes ] Question or discussion
___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
when I learning the feature supported by skywalking, I found the following terms:
1. You don't need to use Language based native agent and Service Mesh probe at the same time, because they both collect metrics data. As a result of that, your system suffers twice payloads, and the analytic numbers are doubled.
2. Use Service Mesh probe with Language based native agent or 3rd-party instrument library in tracing status. (Advanced usage)

I'm confused by the description above,How to properly use native probe in service mesh?
Thanks for your helping
author: EvanLjp

comments.body: In my mind, today, they are alternative. Using them together is very complex, and I assume it is not suitable for an open source project. So, we only suggest you, don't use language agents in the service mesh. If you really want the agent for tracing only, consider adding a flag in the trace receiver, `isAnalysis`, and if it is set as `false`, then trace data only collected but not analysis.

I'm just worried that the mixer won't have enough information to locate the problem
when some error occur in a method and with try catch process ,how to locte it from service mesh information 
Is there a best practice for service mesh tracing?

> Is there a best practice for service mesh tracing?

I talked this multiple times in public conferences. There is no advantage of tracing in mesh. Mesh provides observability without agents in service level, not inside it. If you want the traditional method level or codes level diagnosis, agent is always the best choice.
Thanks for your helping

title: How should we handle the cross-cloud invocation scenario?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

How should we handle the cross-cloud invocation scenario?

In our business scenario, because of the compliance audit, our core payment services run in Alibaba Finance Cloud, and because of the cost considerations, the pre-payment services run in Alibaba Public Cloud. When we make a payment, the trace is from Public to Finance, when the payment finshed, the trace is from Finance to Public.

Currently, our deployment mode of Skywalking is that Finance and Public each have a integrated Skywalking services, which are responsible for the service tracing in their respective Cloud regions.

As we know, it will be discarded if the tracing is from the other Skywalking, because of the registration mechanism, the registration information of the service across the cloud is not available at the other end.

Therefore, in order to support the cross-cloud invocation, we developed a service named inventory_sync_server to finish registration information sync, and also slightly modified some OAP source code. 
The scheme is as follows:
1. Inventory_sync_server was added to monitor the changes of Skywalking registration information, and push the changes to Aliyun RocketMQ. 
Meanwhile, the data monitoring service on the other end will subscribe messages via the Internet HTTP Endpoint to register the changes to Skywalking;
2. The data monitoring service is deployed at both ends to synchronize the application registration information in real time, so that the tracing which across the cloud can be processed;
3. This requires slightly modified of the OAP source code to support this approach;
4. Of course, we also made some other enhancements to support our business scenarios, such as:
      a. carry the user-defined transactionId of frontend to passthrough to the backend services, so that the frontend and business log and Skywalking will be related. We think this is a very practical function;
	  b. Make sure of the cross-cloud invocation has the same treaceId.

This is our way of dealing with it, we are looking forward to some better solutions. Thank you!
author: jackiechan1981

comments.body:
As what you are doing, we don't expect have trace, topology and metrics across cloud, then why don't you simply use namespace to isolate two env?

> Make sure of the cross-cloud invocation has the same treaceId.

You just sync the metadata across cloud, sharing traceid doesn't change the fact, the trace saved in different Clouds. What is the point of this?

BTW, what do you want the SkyWalking community to take part in? I just read the contents, all are about what you did. I assume what you did, defintely makes sense to you. 
Do you intend to share your change? Or something else?

I think maybe this is a complicated discussion, I will send the detail of my questions to dev@skywalking.apache.org. 
If my current problem is resolved and the implementation is adopted, I would be very happy to be a Contributor of Skywalking!
Welcome to join the mail list. Let's discuss there.

comments.body: GraphQL is for query, not for collecting data. So, I am a little confused about your context.
I'm just trying out Skywalking, so it's just the default settings (H2 db) + an account in webapp.yml for secure login.

Two things.
1. I assume you set the wrong port. gRPC port should be used in the agent config.
1. The login has been removed.

> Thanks! I'll check those things. I upgraded from 6.1.0, I took my old webapp.yml file

First, if you run the upgrade, the agent YAML should keep unchanged. That is the thing needs to be rechecked. As you were using 6.1.0, you should reboot the agent after you upgrade. Last thing, H2 default if in memory mode, if you reboot the backend, agent is required to reboot too due to data lost. Auto agent hot reboot(don't need to reboot agent) is supported from 6.4.0, you could check the change log.

A simple question, are you using SkyWalking for test or production? If test considering you are using H2, why there is an upgrade scenario.

> I took my old webapp.yml file

Adding auth should be fine, it is just not working but not blocking the app.

I also noticed a 1hour difference in times between the host time and containers time, so I also fixed the timezone of my containers.

My containers connects fine to Skywalking as per their logs, and then send their traces correctly:

```

}

I'm using Skywalking for test.

Thank you very much for the pointers you gave already.

How many services could you find on your UI side? 

> I made sure to launch Skywalking before the agents.

This is not required. It is OK to be after.

Alright, after checking everything once again to see if I missed anything obvious, I stumbled about other issues about error "IDs can't be null" and seeing the answers that said to check all timezones, I noticed the UI settings on the bottom of the page. 

I believe I didn't see anything on the UI because it was just misconfigured to an old date. I started everything, made some requests and it's all working.
Thanks for your help, I'll try to check all the guides here and see if I can contribute..
I noticed you linked the 6.6.0 milestone to this issue about the webapp auth. Would you like to keep this issue open?

ID can't be null should be ignored by backend. I am sure why you are seeing this. But it is harmness, just a UI tiny bug.

Notice for time, click reload on the page, or open refresh, otherwise, the time stays in the old time.

For auth, there is no short term plan for it, as it is not required, and easily build by user without change codes. I set up milestone for tracking the progress, nothing more.

title: Proxying Apache SkyWalking with Apache WebServer under a different endpoint URL
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

I have a Liferay CE (Java CMS) on Apache Tomcat and Apache SkyWalking installed on the same machine. Liferay is configured to work with the ports 8009, 8080 and 8443 and Apache Skywalking is configured to use TCP_8081. Now I would like to manage the web acces over the Apache Webserver and enable authentication for SkyWalking. So I'd like to have the same hostname for both and Liferay should use the root URL location "/" and SkyWalking should use something like /skywalking - so:

Liferay:         mywebsite.com
SkyWalking: mywebsite.com/skywalking

Unfortunately SkyWalking doesn't work like this. It works only if it is proxied as root (/).
My experiments with the Apache Webserver mod_proxy_html weren't successful.

So, now there are two possibilities:

1) Does anybody know how to proxy Apache SkyWalking wit the Apache WebServer under a different endpoint URL?

2) Or is it possible to configure Apache SkyWalking to start under a different endpont URL, like localhost:8081/skywalking? Like this it would be very easy to proxy it.

I would like to not create a separate virtual host in Apache WebServer for this.

Thank you kindly in advance
___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?
6.5.0, Ubuntu 19.10, Azul OpenJDK 11.0.5
- Which company or project?

- What happen?

___
### Requirement or improvement

comments.body: AFAIK, there is no config way to change root path of current UI. The only option may be changing the source codes.

title: Does suport agent upload data cache to MQ  , oap pick data from MQ?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
Does suport agent upload data cache to MQ first , later oap pick data from MQ?
I find OAP receiver parse Big trace segement（more then 1000+ spans） in heavy load status，CPU reach nearly 100%。（8C16G）。
author: webb2019

comments.body: No, even it is, don't help the CPU payload. It will only make you cost more CPU.

> No, even it is, don't help the CPU payload. It will only make you cost more CPU.
I think the benefit of MQ is that the disk exchange to the CPU，agent respone no timeout，and Reduce CPU pressure  ，Balance busy and idle time of the OAP  。

But with that, the value of a monitoring system is keeping reduce. With several minutes latency to trigger alarm is meaningless. If you want, agent could override a trace sender by a plugin. I just said from my understanding, it is useless for a monitoring system.

title: NodeJS auto-instrument agents cannot be used as expected
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [  ] Question or discussion

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
We shouldn't say we support NodeJS auto-instrument agents, because it cannot run as expected. One critical bug is that span references(childof) is incorrect. The agent lack of a "ThreadLocal" implementation, it cannot set/get per-request context.
author: lixiv

comments.body: NodeJS is not an official Apache repo. The issue is not managed here.

I mean we should modify our documents
SkyWalking supports to collect telemetry (traces and metrics) data from multiple sources and multiple formats, including
Java, .NET Core,  **NodeJS** and PHP auto-instrument agents in SkyWalking format

There is no ThreadLocal in NodeJS. It works for some cases already, we don't need to remove it from my understanding. If it isn't suitable for you, you could contribute, that is how open source project works.

title: I have a startup problem
body:
The es version 7.4 skywalking version 6.4 I used can be accessed normally when I started. When I started the jar, it was also normal, but I could not see the monitoring results in the UI interface
error

author: terrywpf

comments.body: How to configure skywalking correctly

we don't support ES 7.0+ obviously, it's documented in the docs, and `Connection refused (Connection refused)` is a common issue that indicates your server is not alive, make sure the OAP backend starts up successfully first
thks
I have changed the version of 6.8 and it is still this error

> I have changed the version of 6.8 and it is still this error

make sure the OAP backend starts successfully, and it's ( 192.168.2.150:10800 ) accessible from the web app side, please provide more detailed information (including logs) to help to solve the problem

Do you start `apm-webapp` and start the UI with `npm run start` at the same time?
/usr/local/skywalking-6.4.0/bin/startup.sh
Can you help me to look at it remotely
I suggest you firstly solve the problem of `port in use`
And try to determine the reason from your logs, we cannot take charge of all the problems of our users, we can just offer help, but you have obvious problem (port conflict)

Can you send me an appliccation configuration file of git homepage demo program
The problem with port 8080 has been solved

The default config file is good to start. If you want to change, follow the document. The source is open, you need to check the log with the codes, and analysis the result.

Keep posting logs here is not recommended.  The PMC/committer/contributor team is not providing the online tech supports. We are helping when codes have an issue, or you run into a dead end. Clearly, the discussion happens here is not. Please high value the core maintainer's time, they are not a consultant.

title: java agent drop segment data
body:
I use skywalking 6.4.0,  In my test, the agent drop segment data, there are so many “One trace segment has been abandoned, cause by buffer is full.” logs.  And  after inspect the code, I found producer will write data to the buffer, if buffer is not empty, it will drop data after 3 retries. I have some questions:

1. Does skywalking 6.4.0 support `BufferStrategy.BLOCKING` mode? I saw default is  `BufferStrategy.IF_POSSIBLE`, this mode will drop data when buffer is full.
2. I saw `ConsumeDriver` class constructor support thread num, but it's hard code 1 for now. I wonder can I change it to number greater than 1?
author: niyanchun

comments.body:
You shouldn't block, because it will block your business codes, it is dangerous.
Too many threads cause much payload.

Basically, your issue is backend is mot powerful enough. Scale out the oap cluster or storage.

title: security scan of skywalking source
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [X] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
We tried to scan skywalking and get some results:
example:
```
Method getInputStream at line 69 of skywalking-master/oap-server/server-receiver-plugin/zipkin-receiverplugin/
src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/receiver/zipkin/handler/SpanProcessor.java gets user
input from element getInputStream . This element’s value flows through the code without being validated, and
is eventually used in a loop condition in convert at line 48 of skywalking-master/oap-server/server-receiverplugin/
zipkin-receiverplugin/
src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/receiver/zipkin/handler/SpanProcessor.java. This
constitutes an Unchecked Input for Loop Condition.
```

我们正在评测使用Skywalking。
由于公司安全部门的一些要求，对于如上的一些问题，是否会考虑对代码做一些修正？
我们可以来提这些PR
author: wkshare

comments.body: Send the PR with your scan result, I am open to discuss there.

@wu-sheng ok
close the issue, and we will send PRs.

body:
### Question

Grouping is agent's responsibility in agent case. In your case, should be .net agent's.

title: skywalking cannot write ElasticSearch trace data that is not current time
body:
Question

When we use ElasticSearch as a store, we find that skywalking adds the current date to the index name when creating the index, but this will cause trace data that is not the current date to fail to write to the index. Here's an example: Set skywalking TTL time =2 days. When skywalking starts, create ElasticSearch index with the name of segment-20190924. Here, all data of 2019-09-24 will be written into this index, but when 2019-09-25, skywalking will fail to write. The reason is that the index name of skywalking when it writes trace data is segment-20190925, which actually does not exist in ElasticSearch. However, at 2019-09-26, after the previously created index named segment-20190924 was deleted by skywalking due to expiration, skywalking will create a new index named segment-20190926. Then 2019-09-26 trace data starts to be written into ElasticSearch. 

How can we solve this problem?
author: xsisno1

comments.body: It is caused by your Elasticsearch template not created correctly. Maybe upgrade from old version.

> It is caused by your Elasticsearch template not created correctly. Maybe upgrade from old version.

Elasticsearch template was created by skywalking. Is there an update to the skywalking version or Elasticsearch version?
@wu-sheng I am now using the skywalking version 6.3.0
But old SkyWalking doesn't create the template.

> But old SkyWalking doesn't create the template.

Here is a piece of code I saw in 6.3.0 to create the index template:

`boolean isAcknowledged = esClient.createTemplate(model.getName(), settings, mapping);`
6.3.0 yes, but for older version, it is not. But the template is using the same name as old index name. It could conflict.

> 6.3.0 yes, but for older version, it is not. But the template is using the same name as old index name. It could conflict.

Ok, I see. Thank you very much for your help
