title: the reasonable value about sample_n_per_3_secs
body:
I think the config sample_n_per_3_secs is the absolute amount, right?

And I have a question, what'ts the reasonable value about this config, if I want to meet the demands below:
1.Drawing topology that just cover the programs.
2.The trace that just cover all the interfaces of the programs.

We don't hope produce much more data in the pro env, just enough is ok. Of course we couldn't use the default config(as many as possible), the data is so huge.

sample_n_per_3_secs=1 or 10 or 100? Or else, is there some advice? Or the config used in other companies?

3Qs.
author: hepyu

comments.body:
> I think the config sample_n_per_3_secs is the absolute amount, right?

Yes.

> We don't hope produce much more data in the pro env, just enough is ok. Of course we couldn't use the default config(as many as possible), the data is so huge.

That is a tricky question. Because, in a high throughput system, 10~50 is enough. But I will notice, if there is low payload endpoint in such a high throughput system, you have no chance to trace or see it.

So, how many samples per 3 secs based on your storage and network capabilities. For me, I prefer 100, which means 30 tps for each instance. But that effect the metric accurate, be careful.

（TraceSegmentServiceClient的boot方法第70行，carrier.consume(this, 1); 这个消费者的线程为什么配置的是1，有什么原因么？我可以修改变大这个参数么？）

Because too many threads mean high payload to the agent, you CPU will cost more. 

> 2、In my agent log file（ skywalking.log） debug a lot of “DEBUG 2018-10-29 09:25:46 TraceSegmentServiceClient : One trace segment has been abandoned, cause by buffer is full. ”
How can i optimize configured （在其中一个项目忙时的时候agent的日志里有打印很多的trace segment 被丢弃，buffer满了，有没有可以优化的配置，防止数据丢失）

That means your backend is not powerful enough. Buffer is not for saving these segments forever.

> 3、WARN More than 300 spans required to create ，can i configured 1000？（某些方法超过了300个spans，我可以配置到1000么？）

If you have such segment including 1000 spans, you could. Otherwise, I would say, you have span leak.Some plugin or something is not working well.
能说详细点吗？压测的时候不会出现这个问题，闲置的时候反而会出现这个问题
We only accept English discussion. Sorry.

title: Question: can skywalking pass on tag cross thread?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ x ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
The distributed tracing system need to pass the user's tag across threads, for example, I put a value in the http header, the system need to pass the value accross threads, and accross jvm, and try pass on in the whole trace. for example,  the user get the http request, we can set the value in the threadlocal, but if the user create a task submited to threadpool, which maybe lead to loss the value. 


___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: jacky1193610322

comments.body:
We can propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes. But that mechanism is not open to end user in default. Business info propagation is very dangerous, in many cases, they cause memory leak, network traffic disaster. 

You could change our codes to supports that, but I wouldn't recommend to do that.
ok, thank you
Does the apm-toolkit-trace-activation project implementation the feature which propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes ?

> you mean the apm-toolkit-trace-activation project implementation the feature which propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes?

No. There no official API could do the propagation like you said.
I know, you said "We can propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes", I am reading the source, so I want to know which project or class implement the feature you said. thank you

> "We can propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes

This means `#inject`, `#extract`, `#capture` and `#continued` in TracingContext.
Thank you.

comments.body:
This is very new to me. You could reach me in mail, qq group, or other channels. I definitely need more info to address this issue. We don't manipulate `PreparedStatementCallback` from my understanding. Which jdbc driver are you using?

@ascrutae What do you think?

com.mysql.jdbc.Driver

<dependency>
			<groupId>mysql</groupId>

</dependency>

Above is the deoendency that I am using

title: Question: whether skywalking can get the count of inject method call
body: I want to count the inject method call times, for example, log every second or other, I don't know whether skywalking has the function. I mean javaagent output the count directly, not collector sum the count.
author: jacky1193610322

comments.body: No, we don't have that.  Why do we need that?

> No, we don't have that. Why do we need that?

Thanks for reply, Because the collector gets the data with sampling rate， it's not very accurate.

title: Some questions about the agent collecting data
body:

- [x] Question or discussion

- [ ] Requirement
- [x] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- How often does the agent report data to the collector?Can it be configured?（探针发送数据的时间间隔是多少？是否能配置？）
- How big is the agent buffer setting? Can it be configured?（探针收集的数据缓存设置了多大？是否能配置？）

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Can you provide a custom collection strategy? Can do special requests will be collected。（能否提供自定义收集策略，可以做到指定特殊请求都会收集）

thank
author: cyejing

comments.body:
> How often does the agent report data to the collector? Can it be configured?

Consume per 20 ms. See `TraceSegmentServiceClient#L69`. We use DataCarrier's default settings. It is not open now.

> How big is the agent buffer setting? Can it be configured?

See `org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.conf.Config#Buffer`. Default channelSize * bufferSize. You could set anything in Config through `agent.config`

This helped me.
Consume per 20 ms. I think this is a problem. if 20ms have a lot of data into DataCarrier . datacarrier will be discarded data . datacarrier buffer strategy is `BufferStrategy.IF_POSSIBLE`. 
How improve？
How many traces do you intend to add into the buffer in 20ms cycle? I am confusing.
you are right .I mistakenly thought it was 20s

title: Discussion about namespace
body:
### Requirement or improvement
I  found on the skywalking 5.0.0-RC provided a new feature called 'namespace' to isolate different environments. But int the collector instance just can handle one namespace and config it in the yml file. Is there any solution to let the  collector instance handle several namespace for reuse server resource, I think this feature called "multi-tenancy" ？
author: deguste

comments.body:
No, you could use namespace to implement `multi-tenancy`, but it is the same. We don't have tenancy info, backend aggregation isn't designed for supporting that too. 

For backend, if you deploy more than one skywalking cluster, but share zookeeper and ElasticSearch, that is the namespace for.

title: Increase the ability to reset apps and instances
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [X] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
## background
When the user upgrades SkyWalking, the data model of the old and new versions is inconsistent, causing the server to fail to start normally. At this time, the user may adopt the method of clearing the library.
The registration data is lost. The interface will not be able to display the statistical indicators reported by the client that lacks registration information. At the same time, because under the existing mechanism,
The user needs to restart the client to complete the re-registration operation, but the business system restart is not acceptable because of the monitoring system problem.
So we need a mechanism to re-register without restarting the business system.

## ideas
The registration data is lost on the server side and there are two compensation measures:
* Push the registration data cached by the client to the server again, but the ID of the registration data in the cache may have been occupied by other newly registered clients.
Solving such problems is costly.
* Reset the registration data of the problem client. The key elements of this solution are how to identify the problem client and how to send the command to the problem client.

### Key issues
#### Uniquely identifies
At present, the client automatically generates a globally unique agentUUID as the unique identifier of the client instance. However, the operation and maintenance personnel cannot use this identifier.
Accurately locate the server where the client is located, so you need to add the client instance name attribute in the startup file and startup parameters, and manually specify it when the user deploys.
Because the recovery function is not a necessary function of the system, as a non-essential option, the ability to automatically generate the original global unique agentUUID is retained, only when the user is starting.
The original agentUUID is overwritten when the client instance name is specified in the file or startup parameters.
in order to avoid modifying the 5.x protocol, resulting in other language probe linkage upgrade, the attribute of the instance name is added in the heartbeat interface of the 6.x protocol.

#### Problem finding
The client whose registration data is missing is not aware of it. Only the server can find it by parsing the data reported by the client. If the trace details are reported in the interface
Checking, because the order of Trace details is too large and consumes too much performance, so consider the heartbeat interface of the instance to find the problem client, but the current heartbeat interface
Only the instance ID is reported, and the check and friendly prompts cannot be checked. You need to modify this interface to add the instance name attribute to the interface.
Check the ID and instance name at the same time, and prompt in the error log information to check the problematic instance information.

#### Directive is issued
Considering the background of this solution is a very useful function, the instruction does not need to be sent to the client through the server, and the client is directly logged in to the client.
The instruction to reset the registration data, while considering the security problem, can not open the network interface to receive instructions from the client, so the file scanning and listening mode is\used to issue the instruction.
Considering the friendliness of the operator after the command is issued, the client will modify the status information in the file to inform the execution of the reset command.

## Program

### About unique identifier
Configure the instance_code field in agent.conf to ensure that it is globally unique and meaningful so that the operation and maintenance personnel can quickly identify the server where the agent is located.

### About problem finding
The instance heartbeat protocol adds instance_code, and the server uses id and code to check at the same time. If it is not found, the print log (including instanse_code) is used to notify the user to reset the agent.
### About the order
- The listener thread then checks the value of is_register in the .trigger every 3 seconds. If true, the service, instance, network, endpoint cache will be cleared.

- Because the agent-side segment generates network_id and srvice_id, the segment after the cache is emptied is discarded directly before being registered and returned before the network and endpoint. Before the service and instance are registered and returned, the segment is not converted.

- Reset status feedback. After the cache is cleared, status is set to running. After registration is successful, status is set to finish, and status will be written to .trigger every time.

### About .trigger file read and write
Contains 2 attributes
Is_register -> If true, registration will be triggered
Status -> informs the status of the registration, there are three values ​​no_running, running, finish, failed
author: Liu-XinYuan

comments.body: This is a complex feature we are considering. Maybr 6.0.0-alpha
If you have any idea, submit your proposal in google doc or markdown in this issue.

## Re-registration scheme
When it is found that the registration data is lost, the operation and maintenance personnel manually send an instruction to the collector. At this time, the collector will add an instruction parameter to the response when the agent receives the heartbeat, and the agent re-registers the app and instance after receiving the instruction.

First, manually do reset command is NOT very reliable and robust to me.  Why can't be the collector finds that automatically?

And need to design about how to reset at agent sides. 

What changes are you trying to do about the protocol. I think we should be compatible upgrade about this.

Of course, it can be discovered automatically, but the loss of metadata will only occur in certain situations. The question is whether the user needs to know that one of his operations has caused the loss of metadata. If you need to know the user, then manually reset it for a long time and reset it automatically if you don't need it.

Regarding reset of the agent, it is necessary to consider which data is sent to the collector when the agent sends the metadata. When the metadata is not associated with the agent, the agent returns the registration command. At this time, the agent clears the metadata in the cache. , will trigger the registered action

I am also OK with manual reset. But you should know, we will require UI to add setting tab to support this kind of command. 

For agent reset, I mean the details of process, even which data you will reset.  By reviewing these, I can be sure that is the right design.

I need you to provide as detailed info as possible.

For furthermore, I have doubts about doing reset from UI. Considering the metadata(ID) have been deleted, how does the UI show the entrance of reset?

More questions are
1. How do you want to reset your agent? one by one, or reset all.
1. How does the backend know the agent is reset.

After all, I need your scenarios, rather than the simple **reset** requirements to help me review your plans. Like I said, the **proposal** really should be a document.

1. Why develop this feature, and plan
Because the misoperation and data model changes in the collector upgrade process may cause some registration data to be lost, if there is a new agent registration, you may get the same id as the agent that lost the metadata, then the subsequent metrics and traces, Not allowed.
For the loss of metadata, there are two kinds of compensation mechanisms, the agent resends the data in the memory, and the agent re-registers.

1.1 Re-send
The agent directly causes the agent to send the data in the memory to the collector, and the collector to the es. However, since it is serially registered, it may be overwritten by the registered data after the es is written. Therefore, this scheme is not adopted.

1.2 Re-registration
Trigger re-registration by setting the id in the agent-side cache to null

1.2.1 What method is used?
There are two ways to re-register, manual triggering and automatic triggering.

1.2.1.1 Automatic triggering
Loss of metadata due to misoperation is not a defect in the skywalking system. If the reset causes the id of the data before and after the agent to be inconsistent, an exception needs to be thrown to inform the user that his operation has caused the metadata to be lost. Therefore, the method of manually triggering the reset is adopted.

1.2.1.2 Manual trigger
If you choose to manually send commands in the management interface, you need to know which agent registration data is lost. Obviously, the metadata has been lost and there is no way to get it. Similarly, the collector side cannot be manually implemented.

1.2.2 How to identify the agent that needs to be re-registered
Uniquely determine the instance location by adding the instance_code attribute to the agent.conf configuration file.

> Loss of metadata due to misoperation is not a defect in the skywalking system. If the reset causes the id of the data before and after the agent to be inconsistent, an exception needs to be thrown to inform the user that his operation has caused the metadata to be lost. Therefore, the method of manually triggering the reset is adopted.

- Automatic triggering
How do you know about **inconsistent**? For the metadata missing or partial missing, there is no way the backend could know. Could you info me more about `inconsistent check` mechanism? The only thing in my mind, which doesn't break performance, is when you can't get the name of service/endpoint-ip from cache, you know something is wrong. But this is really part of fact called `inconsistent check`. 

For me, this could be dangerous to tell people, SkyWalking has `inconsistent check`, because this mechanism can't guarantee **no exception = data is right**.

> If you choose to manually send commands in the management interface, you need to know which agent registration data is lost. Obviously, the metadata has been lost and there is no way to get it. Similarly, the collector side cannot be manually implemented.

If you can't do this manually, I doubt the meaning of this check. This is not a pattern recognition, which AI may do better than human, otherwise, this is a fault check, I am pretty sure, human check is the most reliable thing and the final defence.

> 1.2.2 How to identify the agent that needs to be re-registered
Uniquely determine the instance location by adding the instance_code attribute to the agent.conf configuration file.

How is this could identify the `needs to` thing? Could you explain more? `Uniquely determine the instance location` this is an ID of service instance, yes. Then?
My proposal, recheck your assumptions, make the plan more executable. In this discussion, we should focus on scenarios, code reactions and manual/auto solutions.

> Automatic triggering
How do you know about inconsistent? For the metadata missing or partial missing, there is no way the backend could know. Could you info me more about inconsistent check mechanism? The only thing in my mind, which doesn't break performance, is when you can't get the name of service/endpoint-ip from cache, you know something is wrong. But this is really part of fact called inconsistent check.

The id before and after the reset may change, then the metrics aggregated according to the id are not allowed.

> For me, this could be dangerous to tell people, SkyWalking has inconsistent check, because this mechanism can't guarantee no exception = data is right.

SkyWalking's consistency check adds instance code to uniquely determine instance to guarantee no-exception=data is right

> If you can't do this manually, I doubt the meaning of this check. This is not a pattern recognition, which AI may do better than human, otherwise, this is a fault check, I am pretty sure, human check is the most reliable thing and the final defence.

I am wrong in this place, the server side can also send instructions to the agent reset through the grpc response. But considering this operation is not a common operation and security problem, do not use the server side reset

>How is this could identify the needs to thing? Could you explain more? Uniquely determine the instance location this is an ID of service instance, yes. Then?

By adding an instanceCode to the agent configuration file, which is determined by the operation and maintenance personnel, they can also find the problem agent according to the instanceCode.
I think you still miss the proposal. The answers to my questions can't tell what should do.

@xingxingyu please don't edit the comments you wrote, if not for fix typo. Otherwise, this issue discussion can't be understood by any other reader.

Consider you have done so, I am closing this issue. Please submit a new one to discuss.

comments.body: This is nothing about the `apm-spring-annotation-plugin`. This exception means agent can't connect or uplink data to backend/collector.
may be apm-spring-annotation-plugin  create much more spans. I have tried it many times，remove this  plugin everything is ok,    after adding  exceptions will occur

> may be apm-spring-annotation-plugin create much more spans. I have tried it many times，remove this plugin everything is ok, after adding exceptions will occur

No. I am pretty sure, this error is nothing about the plugin. If spans trigger something wrong, should have collector side's log or memory related error.

gRPC transports bytes to backend, even don't know the span concept.

adding this plugin there is another exception when  start  app with agent:
```  
WARN  TracingContext :  More than 300 spans required to create
java.lang.RuntimeException: Shadow tracing context. Thread dump
        at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.TracingContext.isLimitMechanismWorking(TracingContext.java:515)
        at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.TracingContext.createLocalSpan(TracingContext.java:290)
        at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.ContextManager.createLocalSpan(ContextManager.java:110)
        at org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.spring.annotations.SpringAnnotationInterceptor.beforeMethod(SpringAnnotationInterceptor.java:32)
        at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.InstMethodsInter.intercept(InstMethodsInter.java:89)
        at springfox.documentation.schema.property.ObjectMapperBeanPropertyNamingStrategy.nameForDeserialization(ObjectMapperBeanPropertyNamingStrategy.java)
        at springfox.documentation.schema.property.BeanPropertyDefinitions.name(BeanPropertyDefinitions.java:48)
        at springfox.documentation.schema.property.OptimizedModelPropertiesProvider.beanModelProperty(OptimizedModelPropertiesProvider.java:281)

        at springfox.documentation.schema.property.OptimizedModelPropertiesProvider$2.apply(OptimizedModelPropertiesProvider.java:163)
        at springfox.documentation.schema.property.OptimizedModelPropertiesProvider$2.apply(OptimizedModelPropertiesProvider.java:155)
        at com.google.common.base.Present.transform(Present.java:79)  ```
That [warn] means you are trying to create over 300 spans in a single segment. I wonder this is your real purpose. It is very dangerous for your memory.
These are automatically generated. what should I do?

> These are automatically generated. what should I do?

I don't know what does your application do, and why do you have so many spans in a single request. Only you or your team can say this is reasonable or some incompatible bug. I don't know, sorry.

body:

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Bug

skywalking 5.0.0.RC  rocketmq 4.2.4

- Which company or project?

- What happen?
ERROR 2018-07-24 20:38:27 InstMethodsInter :  class[class org.apache.rocketmq.client.consumer.ConsumerProxy$1] before method[consumeMessage] intercept failure 
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "OrderDiffQueue/Producer"
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:580)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:615)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.trace.TraceSegmentRef.<init>(TraceSegmentRef.java:86)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.TracingContext.extract(TracingContext.java:167)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.ContextManager.createEntrySpan(ContextManager.java:99)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.rocketMQ.v4.AbstractMessageConsumeInterceptor.beforeMethod(AbstractMessageConsumeInterceptor.java:53)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.InstMethodsInter.intercept(InstMethodsInter.java:82)
	at org.apache.rocketmq.client.consumer.ConsumerProxy$1.consumeMessage(ConsumerProxy.java)
	at org.apache.rocketmq.client.impl.consumer.ConsumeMessageConcurrentlyService$ConsumeRequest.run(ConsumeMessageConcurrentlyService.java:421)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)


___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: Yuanxiangz

comments.body: @Yuanxiangz I am not following. `entryOperationName` should have a `#` prefix in the header. But the carrier has already done this by `ContextCarrier#setParentOperationName`. Are you doing anything, which misses this method when process the header?

Thanks sheng, I have found the error reason. it's not a skywalking issue. In our test env we use a prefix to tell the different. for the same rocketmq topic like OrderDiffQueue in our T2 env, the topic name will be "T2|OrderDiffQueue". in that case, when skywalking use "|" to split the text will get a wrong result. i will fix it in my private branch to replace "|" in topic to "/". For your question, I have thought the deserialize method's input, the parts[5] may be not start with "#" in some cases.
I see. Thanks for your explanation. @ascrutae What do you use for carrier propagation? Why does this affect the topic name?
I use the `Message#UserProperty` to propagate the trace context. and we didn't change any property of the message in this plugin

> I use the Message#UserProperty to propagate the trace context. and we didn't change any property of the message in this plugin

I thought in that way too. @Yuanxiangz Could you provide more info? What do you have this problem?

Don't try to update SkyWalking without deleting the existed es tables.

Simple way, delete es data folder. All data will lose, agent need reboot.

title: Do we support non microservice standalone java applications?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [-] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

___
### Bug
- Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?

- Which company or project?

- What happen?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: asivanadi

comments.body: What do you mean about `non microservice standalone java applications`? I am not following. Desktop application? or something?
A simple java application that does not have any rest apis exposed.

> A simple java application that does not have any rest apis exposed.

Then what do you want an APM to do for that application? Tracing SQL access maybe?
to trace all the outbound http/https/sql/no-sql calls

> to trace all the outbound http/https/sql/no-sql calls

If the application doesn't exit after the calls, because we are using async sending mechanism, it definitely can trace those outgoing RPC calls.
yes traces are available, but we are not able to see the topology of the application

> yes traces are available, but we are not able to see the topology of the application

You should. From this application to other remotes nodes in normal cases.
any sample spring-boot standalone java app to test?

> any sample spring-boot standalone java app to test?

We haven't. Sorry. But in theory, it should be. Because in SkyWalking core, topology is from the every RPC, no matter it is incoming or outgoing.

title: C#/.NET instrument agent  support RabbitMQ or Kafka

ok, I have changed it.

title: Exception while fetching data (/applicationAlarmList) : all shards failed
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ v] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- Exception while fetching data (/applicationAlarmList) : all shards failed
- Exception while fetching data (/serverAlarmList) : all shards failed

5.0.0 beta
author: liliang8858

comments.body: I think there are caused by your ES settings. Not relate with SkyWalking.
@wu-sheng    ES is normal. This error occurred after running for some time

> @wu-sheng ES is normal. This error occurred after running for some time

I doubt that. Shards are managed by ElasticSearch itself, not by us.

@wu-sheng 
`org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.core.module.ModuleStartException: Field named mi in application_mapping_minute index not found.
        at org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.storage.es.StorageModuleEsProvider.start(StorageModuleEsProvider.java:300) ~[collector-storage-es-provider-5.0.0-beta-SNAPSHOT.jar:5.0.0-beta-SNAPSHOT]

        at org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.storage.es.base.define.ElasticSearchStorageInstaller.columnCheck(ElasticSearchStorageInstaller.java:72) ~[collector-storage-es-provider-5.0.0-beta-SNAPSHOT.jar:5.0.0-beta-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.storage.StorageInstaller.install(StorageInstaller.java:60) ~[collector-storage-define-5.0.0-beta-SNAPSHOT.jar:5.0.0-beta-SNAPSHOT]

`
That is also another issue caused by you, when you do some upgrades, but didn't clear the ES indexes. beta release is incompatible with alpha.

> @ wu-sheng ES很正常。运行一段时间后发生此错误



> @ wu-sheng 3q 
> es：6.2.3 
> collector-libs / elasticsearch-5.5.0.jar - > collector-libs / elasticsearch-5.6.0.jar


Did you solve it?I had a similar problem, asking for help
Es 6 is not supported. Read document please.

Ok,Thanks for your answer!
There I just found the initialize function for ElasticSearch Client by using PreBuiltTransportClient,but PreBuiltXPackTransportClient is needed for that authentication.You are right,the X-pack is not free,and it is not a good idea to support X-pack authentication.

comments.body: Could you give me an demo to reproduce this issue?

@ascrutae Maybe this is an issue we already fixed? Can you tell that from the stack only? 

@doublebody I am not sure that you provided enough info. In beta release, some SpringMVC forward, or SpringMVC + hystrix may cause this.

I am afraid not that we don't fixed this issue yet. Because There is  an `ClassCastException` exception display in the stack. and it show me that maybe there is some trouble about the ClassLoader.
>org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.method.annotation.ServletInvocableHandlerMethod] after method[getBean] intercept failure
java.lang.ClassCastException: **org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.spring.mvc.commons.EnhanceRequireObjectCache** cannot be cast to **org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.spring.mvc.commons.EnhanceRequireObjectCache**
it may caused by spring security ?
Could you give me demo for reproduce this issue? @doublebody

INFO 2018-06-14 19:06:51 GetBeanInterceptor :  this EnhancedInstance classload is :org.springframework.boot.devtools.restart.classloader.RestartClassLoader@7f301ecb 
INFO 2018-06-14 19:06:51 GetBeanInterceptor :  this EnhanceRequireObjectCache classload is :org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.loader.AgentClassLoader@5a26621a 
INFO 2018-06-14 19:06:51 GetBeanInterceptor :  this getSkyWalkingDynamicField classload is :org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.loader.AgentClassLoader@43deaeba
已解决，spring-boot-devtools,RestartClassLoader影响

This incompatibility with devtool has been addressed by PR #6973.

You could try with the master branch or wait for the next release 8.6.0.

Feedback is welcome.

title: There is a problem in the agent configuration of tomcat 8 in quick start document.
body:
linux 环境下，tomcat 7和tomcat8的探针配置应该是一样的，文档中tomcat8的配置应该是windows系统的配置
路径：incubator-skywalking/docs/en/Deploy-skywalking-agent.md
author: haotian2015

comments.body: Please feel free to submit your pr to modify the en/cn documents.
You can fix these things for the community. We are always welcome your contributions.

title: Will skywalking 5.0 support Elasticsearch 6.x  ?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

### Why do you submit this issue?
 Requirement
 Feature or performance improvement
___

### Question
- What do you want to know?

Will skywalking 5.0 support Elasticsearch 6.x ？
If it will not , can you give me some advise on how to do it by myself ?
___

### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.

My company want's to use skywalking but we have already used Elasticsearch 6.x . We can't build another environment for skywalking so I need some support.
author: clorxd

comments.body:
> My company want's to use skywalking but we have already used Elasticsearch 6.x . We can't build another environment for skywalking so I need some support.

I prefer you do the upgrade by yourself. This upgrade will bring many potential uncompatible issues. I think we have no plan to update the version, at least before 5.0.0-GA. FYI @peng-yongsheng 

If you will/can provide the ES6 version storage implementation module, that will be great. SkyWalking collector is based on modulization design, so easy to change the dependency though application.yml

title: Does the config : agent.sample_n_per_3_secs support such a way like this : 10% 、20% and does the config file : agent.config support dynamic loading?
body: As title
author: jasdhl

comments.body:
> agent.sample_n_per_3_secs support such a way like this : 10% 、20%

No. But if you want, you could contribute a new optional plugin to support this sample mechanism.  Override `SamplingService` service, by learning from `/apm-sniffer/optional-plugins/trace-ignore-plugin`. This plugin overrides `TraceIgnoreExtendService` service to support new feature.

Welcome to join the community.

> does the config file : agent.config support dynamic loading

This is not an easy YES or NO question. Because some settings, such as application code, buffer size, are hard to change in runtime. So I suggest you focus on which settings do you want to dynamic reload.
thanks

comments.body: Are you using our release versions? I have no idea. These services must be implemented by our collector.

skywalking-5.0.0-alpha

Thank you very much!
If so, I think the problem may be caused by that, you are using the wrong port for agent.

naming:
  jetty:
    host: ip
remote:
  gRPC:
    host: ip
    port: 11800
-------------------------------
If IP is changed with 'localhost', local  application can be collected.
If IP is changed with 0.0.0.0, all Agent reports this wrong.
If IP is replaced with real IP, the wrong( Cannot assign requested address)

> If IP is changed with 'localhost', local application can be collected.

Mean our release version is correct, and work well.

> If IP is changed with 0.0.0.0, all Agent reports this wrong.

Is the collector still running in local? I assume no.

> If IP is replaced with real IP, the wrong( Cannot assign requested address)

That is caused by your machine settings. Your real IPs is not real as you thought, the OS didn't allow you to bind this IP. You should deal with this through adjusting your OS settings.

Thank you very much. My server is Aliyun. The server is the VPC host of the proprietary network. If other servers want to access, it can only be configured as 0.0.0.0. But IP must be reported  as 0.0.0.0.

If you want or have to use 0.0.0.0, please follow direct link doc. And can't run in cluster mode. 

I think you should use IP in VPC for collector, and agent uses direct link to connect. This is what I am using.
If agent and collector both in the same VPC, you can use the LAN address. Why you choose Internet address to bind?

> If agent and collector both in the same VPC, you can use the LAN address. Why you choose Internet address to bind?

Same question from me. You should have those IPs.

author: candyleer

comments.body:
> Now,I have an application and it is slow in some machine, but i don't know which machine, so Do we need add hostname or other info to traceSegment or add tag to span?

There is an application id and instance id in every segment, which include application code, machine info, such as ip, hostname, processid.

I think I can move this into a query requirement for trace, to discuss whether could we provide this in beta2.
@hanahmily @peng-yongsheng What do you think about this in beta2? It makes sense in some cases. I am just not sure about the milestone.
I'm ok. Collector and UI are easy to support it. But there were so many agent plugins need to develop and test.
From the application instance id, backend knows already. No need to adjust any plugin.

comments.body:
Please look your `application.yml` in your collector config directory. The following settings are alarm related. And I think it is easy to understand. 

```yaml
# alarm threshold
    applicationApdexThreshold: 2000
    serviceErrorRateThreshold: 10.00
    serviceAverageResponseTimeThreshold: 2000
    instanceErrorRateThreshold: 10.00
    instanceAverageResponseTimeThreshold: 2000
    applicationErrorRateThreshold: 10.00
    applicationAverageResponseTimeThreshold: 2000
```
3Q

title: Segment buffer pre read failure
body:
### Question
I have a problem when i restart the collector.I clear es data and buffer, but I can't start it.
2018-05-15 14:05:41,163 - org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.analysis.segment.parser.provider.buffer.SegmentBufferReader -7345 [pool-4-thread-1] ERROR [] - Segment buffer pre read failure.

org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.core.UnexpectedException: Received an instance heart beat message under instance id= 9 , which doesn't exist.
author: xujingbin

comments.body:
> org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.core.UnexpectedException: Received an instance heart beat message under instance id= 9 , which doesn't exist.

Agent is still running in old context. Instance ID and many other IDs are cached in agent sides. 

So my suggestion is, if you want to upgrade the backend or clear all data, make sure all agents shut down.

title: Does Trace Data Protocol have any upgrade plan in 5.x series?
body:
skywalking是一个很好的开源项目，我这边准备直接在公司试用，但是由于5.0对比3.x有协议变更，为了避免升级的麻烦，准备直接上5.0，请问作者有什么好的建议没？另外，还有如题的疑问，辛苦作者 ：）

----
# Translation
SkyWalking is a good open source project, I am going to use it in my company. But the Trace Data Protocol is changed in 5.0 from 3.0. So for avoid the problems, we are going to use 5.0 directly. So I want to ask for suggestions. And does the project team have any upgrade plan?

By @wu-sheng
author: HouZhiHouJue

comments.body: FYI @HouZhiHouJue , I just translate your issue, please keep it in English.

Thanks for be interesting in our project. We are going to release the 5.0.0-beta in this month. 

> Does Trace Data Protocol have any upgrade plan in 5.x series?

One of our PMC, @peng-yongsheng , asked for some changes, but didn't be accepted by the project yet. We will be very careful about the upgrade. 

But, I have to say, if you are only using it, you should not care too much about the protocol. Because, the agent, collector and UI always match in our release. For new release, even I assume we change the protocol, the hardest thing you did will be that, upgrade your all agents.

Unless, you are going to process the trace data by your own, or want to work on some other agents or SDKs. If that case, please notice our team, we will ping you before the changes, just like we will ping @liuhaoyang 's .NET agent and @ascrutae 's nodejs agent teams.
ok, thanks.

title: Reason for changing  network.host in elasticsearch yml
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [X ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

What is the reason for changing  network.host  to 0.0.0.0. in elasticsearch yml
___
author: arghya88

comments.body:
It is not necessary, but have a story about users.
Most of users deploy elasticsearch and collector in the cloud. But the virtual machine provide 2 address.(e.g. Internet address, VLAN address), but usually, elasticsearch bind to the VLAN address, so we suggest them setting the host to 0.0.0.0.
`0.0.0.0` is also used only when you deploy collector in local or the same machine with monitored application. In product env, the real IP address is required.
For elasticsearch, I think it is binding to `localhost` by default, then collector may couldn't connect to it.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe about your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: arghya88

comments.body: Do you set the server addresses right? Please read our document and server address should be `ip:10800` by default.

Agent uses `naming/jetty` for service discovery, and `agent_gRPC/gRPC` for real connection. From your 404, I think you didn't set the address to `naming/jetty`.

Another thing may cause this, because your collector didn't start up right. Please recheck your collector log.

I was giving remotehost:8080 in agent conf and now after changing it to remotehost:10800 I am getting connection refused in agent logs. Telneting to port 10800 is not working also.
Nothing found in collector.log or webapp.log-both are empty..
Found some logs in walking-collector-server.log but no error/exception

The `collector.servers` setting is based on this section in `application.yml`:
```
naming:
  jetty:
    host: localhost
    port: 10800
    contextPath: /
```
No further discussion. Closing this.

title: Tomcat and Dubbo Monitoring
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [] Question or discussion

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?

We currently have a project like this: the Web tier is tomcat 8.5.x+spring mvc 4.3.x, and the Server tier is tomcat 8.5.x+dubbo 2.8.4, and I deploy the single version of skywalking 3.2.6 according to the quick start, which can be monitored. But there are two problems:
1) In topology, the web trace and the server trace are separated, that is, two branches, can it be merged into one branch, and I've deployed the dubbo monitor.
2) The information such as JVM and CPU is not monitored in UI, and there isn't JVM monitoring item in the Menu in Dashboard.
author: weenyaimac

comments.body: Please rewrite the issue description in English for helping global community to find existed issue.
@weenyaimac Updated your issue, and removed your latest comments.

> In topology, the web trace and the server trace are separated, that is, two branches, can it be merged into one branch, and I've deployed the dubbo monitor.

Are you active `com.alibaba.dubbo.monitor.support.MonitorFilter` filter in Dubbo? Our instrumentation based on that.

> The information such as JVM and CPU is not monitored in UI, and there isn't JVM monitoring item in the Menu in Dashboard.

Which version do you use for tests? If you have any data, JVM definitely metrics are definite included.

@wu-sheng Thanks first. I remember MonitorFilter in Dubbo is activeted by default. Pls see following dubbo code:
`@Activate(group = { **Constants.PROVIDER, Constants.CONSUMER** }) `
`public class MonitorFilter implements Filter {}`

I just solved the first question, in the way of which I deleted the tomcat plugin of the agent in the service tier. As of the second question, I test my project using v3.2.6 release. Do the two applications need to open JMX or configure application.yml of collector?

Oh, happy you solve 1) by yourself, good work.

For 3.2.6, or 5.x, no settings required for JVM metrics. Can you provide some screenshots of `Application Instance`, and what shows after you clicked an instance in that page.

Yes, that depends how does your intercepted object use in thread? if no concurrency situation, you can use dynamic field to propagate. If has, use your own thread local, or proposal to add runtime context for TracingContext.

Does the before and after method interceptor guarantee to run on same thread?
What is the original purpose of Tag in span?

Sent from my iPhone

Yes, they are always in one thread, guarantee by Javs stack module, not by SkyWalking. But you must be careful of concurrency. For tags, those are from OpenTracing, which tag the info for backend analysis, aggregation and visualization.

title: Grouping the performance matrix per application instead per VM
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
Is it possible to let the agent return per application's performance matrix instead per VM? For example I have J2ee container and multiple application has been deployed.
author: zone1511

comments.body:
@zone1511 I think that will be hard, because of following reasons:
1. JVM/server metrics are only related to VM, Sorry.
1. Application topology map based on this application, instead of VM-level application, will make people hard to understand, and more complex. Also, we are facing to move Docker based arch, right? It is not popular to deploy more than one application in a container, even not popular in Cloud or VM based env.
1. This requirement ask a change to our core, in order to allow two application context existed.
1. We need to rename application to config + `/webroot`, causes more config for end users.

So, in technical way, it is possible. But I would say easy.

Do you think it is worth to do so?

One challenge I can think of is how to identify two figure comes from two application. For j2ee. Class loader is a good way to identify but if the class is loaded from parent class loader then it is complicated. Anyway. Just brain storm the possibility. 

Sent from my iPhone

> On 2 Feb 2018, at 2:15 PM, 吴晟 Wu Sheng <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> @zone1511 I think that will be hard, because of following reasons:
> 
> JVM/server metrics are only related to VM, Sorry.
> Application topology map based on this application, instead of VM-level application, will make people hard to understand, and more complex. Also, we are facing to move Docker based arch, right? It is not popular to deploy more than one application in a container, even not popular in Cloud or VM based env.
> This requirement ask a change to our core, in order to allow two application context existed.
> We need to rename application to config + /webroot, causes more config for end users.
> So, in technical way, it is possible. But I would say easy.
> 
> Do you think it is worth to do so?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
>

> One challenge I can think of is how to identify two figure comes from two application. For j2ee. Class loader is a good way to identify but if the class is loaded from parent class loader then it is complicated. Anyway. Just brain storm the possibility.

I think you didn't need this complex way to identify the web application. You can use the web-root detection to find out the application's web root path. Then, when you have a transaction, you can know the application based the url prefix.

title: [Collector] add prefix for all storage table name
body: Prefix to increase the table name, easy to distinguish between shared storage cluster
author: myoss

comments.body:
Thanks for your suggestion.  Please use English since your comments are documented by ASF. Chinese is not a good way, sadly. :(

Besides the prefix of table name (not a technical problem), I have concerns about sharing the same ES cluster with other system. Because SkyWalking give ES a lot write-load, unless target systems are simple(doubt that), do we recommend people to do such things? @apache/skywalking-committers
The elasticsearch database provide sharding index. Unless you want to use relation database such as mysql.

> The elasticsearch database provide sharding index. Unless you want to use relation database such as mysql.

@myoss Please ignore this, I think @peng-yongsheng misunderstand your point. This is about distinguishing tables only.
i want to use in elasticsearch ...

Sorry, I misunderstand the word distinguish as distributed.

#### I don't recommend every one to share database.
* 1 The collector will write huge data into db, so other systems will be affected.
* 2 The size of the es cluster is different between skywalking and other systems, this will makes it difficult to expand the cluster.

As 2 PMC members(@wu-sheng @peng-yongsheng ) don't recommend sharing es. So sorry to say, we are not going to adjust this in official version. If you have these requirements, feel free the download source codes, and changes few codes. It is easy, to be honest.
More people require for this feature, I start a new proposal here: #932 @myoss

title: [Agent] how to specify which logger to be use by java agent
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

### What version of sky-walking are you using?
3.2.6

### What version of your OS?
windows

### What version of your JRE?
1.8


From the code LogManager.setLogResolver, seems no one call it at all and it is always using the easyLogResolver. How to switch to other logging framework? do I need to implement a LogResolver?
author: zone1511

comments.body: Yes, you are. And because of compiling and class loader problems, you will find out, you must make sure the log implementation and all dependencies must be inside agent. So no one will call it, except the agent itself.
After I implemented a Log Resolver, how does LogManager pick it up? Since JUL is a build in logger for JDK, will you consider use it so there is no classloading issue?

@zone1511 Sorry for delay. Apache stuffs take me a lot of energy in these days. 

> After I implemented a Log Resolver, how does LogManager pick it up? Since JUL is a build in logger for JDK, 

After you implement the LogResolver, you must change the initial codes by calling `LogManager#setLogResolver`. I would recommend you to do that by adding a static block in `LogManager`.

> will you consider use it so there is no classloading issue?

If you are using all JDK codes, it will not trigger classloader issue. But if your application is also using JUL, the logging config will be influenced. That is why we only use our own implementation, rather than any other log components.

@wu-sheng congrad for moving the project into apache.

if you extend those standard JUL logger then you can attach a configuration which config the agent's logger log to your JUL logger implementation and other applications which use  JUL will not be affected.

> congrad for moving the project into apache

Thanks. But the moving is still on going. Something is not right so far.

> if you extend those standard JUL logger then you can attach a configuration which config the agent's logger log to your JUL logger implementation and other applications which use JUL will not be affected.

If they know JUL configuration well. you definitely can. So here is my proposal, if you are interested in JUL so much, I welcome you provide implementation by using JUL, and allow people to use config(file/system properties/sys env) to switch it.

But pay attention about some `LogManager#getLogger` execute before SnifferConfigInitializer, maybe you can't override those logs by now.
No more updates in a month. Closing it.

title: 咨询agent打包的问题
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

### What version of sky-walking are you using?
3.2.5

### What version of your OS?
CentOS 7

### What version of your JRE?
1.8

### What company or project?
ali

### What did you do?
If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

#### 问题1
agent.jar包有16mb多，主要是org.skywalking.apm.dependencies这个目录下面的文件很大，请问下这个目录中将第三方的class的package都被加上了 “org.skywalking.apm.dependencies” 前缀，主要作用是什么？

#### 问题2
因为agent的文件，是被分成3个目录（目录中包含多个jar包或者配置文件）+ skywalking-agent.jar 这个文件，现在想用这个来部署到服务器是非常痛苦的（生产实例太多），想做成一个flat jar（类似spring boot jar包），这样项目中直接依赖即可，升级和发布都会很方便，能否考虑下？

#### 问题3
能否多点架构设计的文档，便于快速了解整个项目，进行二次开发，谢谢。
author: myoss

comments.body:
> 问题1
agent.jar包有16mb多，主要是org.skywalking.apm.dependencies这个目录下面的文件很大，请问下这个目录中将第三方的class的package都被加上了 “org.skywalking.apm.dependencies” 前缀，主要作用是什么？

org.skywalking.apm.dependencies是为了保证探针依赖的完全独立性，避免和应用程序依赖树冲突。

> 问题2
因为agent的文件，是被分成3个目录（目录中包含多个jar包或者配置文件）+ skywalking-agent.jar 这个文件，现在想用这个来部署到服务器是非常痛苦的（生产实例太多），想做成一个flat jar（类似spring boot jar包），这样项目中直接依赖即可，升级和发布都会很方便，能否考虑下？

你说的fat jar，老版本的探针很早就支持，但是这并不给你带来你理想中的方便。因为探针有Plugin可能和应用冲突，需要移除；你可能开发非开源的plugin，此时打包会困难；配置文件无法防止和方便修改。生产实例的部署，我们一般建议采用shell完成安装脚本，进行自动化安装和拷贝。

> 问题3
能否多点架构设计的文档，便于快速了解整个项目，进行二次开发，谢谢。

开源项目的快速迭代，我们一般保持接口稳定，而非架构代码的绝对稳定，所以，暂时无法以稳定文档的方式提供。
@wu-sheng 历史版本是否有读取fat jar包里的 plugin jar 代码？如果有，能否帮忙找下git commit hash值，感谢。我会考虑在启动的时候，读取需要禁用的插件配置，不加载到 classloader 里。如果开发自己的plugin，进行二次打包问题不大。因为公司部署平台差异化问题，我们现在很难采用shell方式完成。
历史版本读取方式完全不同，需要回退部分核心代码才能完成相关功能。skywalking团队不建议采用该方式，因为运作机制不同，很难保证目前的插件能够在老机制下正常运行。

```java
protected Object doInvoke(Object... args) throws Exception {
		ReflectionUtils.makeAccessible(getBridgedMethod());
		try {
			return getBridgedMethod().invoke(getBean(), args);
		}
		catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
			assertTargetBean(getBridgedMethod(), getBean(), args);
			String text = (ex.getMessage() != null ? ex.getMessage() : "Illegal argument");
			throw new IllegalStateException(getInvocationErrorMessage(text, args), ex);
		}
		catch (InvocationTargetException ex) {
			// Unwrap for HandlerExceptionResolvers ...
			Throwable targetException = ex.getTargetException();
			if (targetException instanceof RuntimeException) {
				throw (RuntimeException) targetException;
			}
			else if (targetException instanceof Error) {
				throw (Error) targetException;
			}
			else if (targetException instanceof Exception) {
				throw (Exception) targetException;
			}
			else {
				String text = getInvocationErrorMessage("Failed to invoke handler method", args);
				throw new IllegalStateException(text, targetException);
			}
		}
	}
```

The idea is very simple. Every gRPC service has a Downstream response, of course it is NOTHING in it for now. title: Puzzles about the InstanceMethodsAroundInterceptor
body: The method InstanceMethodsAroundInterceptor.afterMethod()  may be replace origin return value?why do that?i think that is a risk while the interceptor's implements is poor.may cause break the origin business.don't know what i said right?
author: ethanlawrence

comments.body:
First of all, you are right about altering the return value.

The `InstanceMethodsAroundInterceptor`  and `StaticMethodsAroundInterceptor` both have the capabilities to alter the return value, in both `before` and `after` methods.

* In **after**, override the origin return value.
* In **before**, even mean don't call the origin method.

The risk you mentioned is **true**, but this feature is needed in some plugins:
1. You can check the `JDBCDriverInterceptor#afterMethod`, need to create a `SWConnection` to replace the old one for keeping the connect-url.
1. This Kafka plugin( released in future ), the message is a byte array, which returns by a serializer. In order to keep the trace's cross-process continuation, agent must add a ContextCarrier into the byte array. So we must have the capability to change it.

Although we had took this risk into consideration, so since 3.2, we let the enhanced class implement `EnhancedInstance` interface and a dynamic field to carry extra info. By supporting this, we can avoid to alter return value in most cases, but not all of them, such as kafka plugin.

If you want to contribute or develop a new plugin, please make sure altering return value just is necessary.

And a final thing, sky-walking agent didn't ask the application developers to change their source code manually, but the changing is still be done in runtime. So risks of breaking application always exist, we must do these carefully.
Closing this issue. If you need more explanations, please let me know.

title: createAPP大小写错误
author: ccknot

comments.body:
如下面shell命令，我们的应用已经部署到linux环境下，没有发生所述问题。
请反馈是否由于操作系统等原因，造成这种问题？

``` shell
devusr11@host-10-1-241-16:/aifs01/users/devusr11/applications/TD1_TST-S1/skywalking/ftl/app> ls
createAPP.ftl
devusr11@host-10-1-241-16:/aifs01/users/devusr11/applications/TD1_TST-S1/skywalking/ftl/app> uname -a
Linux host-10-1-241-16 2.6.32-431.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Nov 22 03:15:09 UTC 2013 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
devusr11@host-10-1-241-16:/aifs01/users/devusr11/applications/TD1_TST-S1/skywalking/ftl/app> lsb_release -a 
LSB Version:    :base-4.0-amd64:base-4.0-noarch:core-4.0-amd64:core-4.0-noarch:graphics-4.0-amd64:graphics-4.0-noarch:printing-4.0-amd64:printing-4.0-noarch
Distributor ID: CentOS
Description:    CentOS release 6.5 (Final)
Release:    6.5
Codename:   Final
```

Debain 7
不是系统问题，
skywalking-webui\src\main\java\com\ai\cloud\controller\AppMaintainCtl.java
这个文件的return "app/createApp" ，createApp的pp是小写
skywalking-webui\src\main\webapp\ftl\app\createAPP.ftl
这个PP是大写

linux都是区分大小写的吧

好的，我已经修改createAPP.ftl文件名，代码已经提交。
不清楚为什么我们的linux系统为什么没有发生问题。
